saevis: <entryFree id="n42234" type="main" key="saevis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saevis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. saevus.</entryFree>
saevitas: <entryFree id="n42235" type="main" key="saevi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saevĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saevus</etym>, <sense id="n42235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fury</hi> (late Lat.), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 483; Firm. Math. 5, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 9, § 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Spirit. Sanc. 3, 16, 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saeviter: <entryFree id="n42236" type="main" key="saevi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saevĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. saevus <sense id="n42236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <foreign lang="greek">b.</foreign></sense></entryFree>
saevitia: <entryFree id="n42237" type="main" key="saevi^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saevĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (collat. form <case>acc.</case> saevitiem, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 181 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saevus</etym>, <sense id="n42237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a raging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierceness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferocity</hi>. </sense><sense id="n42237.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut aves ad volatum, equi ad cursum, ad saevitiam ferae gignuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 146</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42237.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for any violent, passionate excitement, <hi rend="ital">fierceness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savageness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruelty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barbarity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n42237.3" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">num meam saevitiam veritus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in judicio aut saevitiam aut clementiam judicis (sibi proponet),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; so (with immanitas) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feneratorum (shortly before: violentia atque crudelitas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iasidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">creditorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secandi urendique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitiam reprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum saevitia glisceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus saevitiis et maxime faenoris onere oppressa plebs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 9</bibl></cit> Dietsch; cf. id. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 40</bibl> ib.—</sense><sense id="n42237.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scyllae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 51, § 166</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignea (i. e. sacri ignis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dearness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saevities: <entryFree id="n42238" type="main" key="saevi^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saevĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, v. saevitia.</entryFree>
saevitudo: <entryFree id="n42239" type="hapax" key="saevi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saevĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saevus</etym>, <sense id="n42239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ferocity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi> (for the class. saevitia): mala, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saevus: <entryFree id="n42240" type="main" key="saevus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saevus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">saevis</orth>, e; in <sense id="n42240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> saevium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29, 5</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. akin with scaevus, q. v.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">roused to fierceness</hi> (while ferus signifies naturally fierce); <hi rend="ital">raging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferocious</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>) </sense><sense id="n42240.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 306</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1016" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1016</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saecla leonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:862" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 862</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leaena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:90" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevior leaena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 404</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 387</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42240.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of any vehement, passionate excitement, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barbarous</hi>, etc. (syn.: crudelis, inmitis, trux, durus). </sense><sense id="n42240.3" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc truculento mihi atque saevo usus sene est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; so (with truculentus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestis, saevus, tristis, parcus, truculentus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 8, 20: ex amore saevus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <trans><tr>cross</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magister,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novercae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:47" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tisiphone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater Cupidinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Proserpina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Necessitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 581</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tyranno saevissimo et violentissimo in suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevus metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquanto post civilis belli victoriam saevior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post cujus interitum vel saevissimus exstitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevorum saevissime Centaurorum, Euryte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 219</bibl></cit> et saep.: saevus in armis Aeneas acuit Martem, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">deino/s,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hector,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 177</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achilles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:582" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed manibus qui saevus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:67" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium in pellice saevae deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videt Atridas Priamumque et saevum ambobus Achillem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevus accusandis reis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (cf. saevio, II. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaelibet in quemvis opprobria fingere saevus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevior ante alios iras servasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:7" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42240.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things: mare, Naev. ap. Fest. s. v. topper, p. 352 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 559</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 805</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1616" /> <cb n="SAGA" /> 222: saevi exsistunt turbines, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:39:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 39, 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 8</bibl>: tempestates, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 388, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 458</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:52" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 313</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falx Priapi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 45</bibl></cit>: tympana, <hi rend="ital">sounding harshly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">terribly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 13</bibl> et saep.: saevo ac duro in bello, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 388, 15</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 475</bibl></cit>: saeva et tristia dicta, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 388, 23</bibl>: unde superstitiosa primum saeva evasit vox fera, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:6 sq" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 33, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex saevis et perditis rebus ad meliorem statum fortuna revocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:Fragm. 6, p. 419" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. Fragm. 6, p. 419</bibl></cit> Osann (5, p. 247 B. and K.; ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 23</bibl>): Medea amore saevo saucia, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl>; and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 8, 18</bibl> (Trag. v. 288 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">Amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sibi belligeranti saeva vel prospera evenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut saeva et detestanda Quirinio clamitarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa saevaque questus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, in three forms, saeve, saeviter (anteclass.), and saevum (in post-Aug. poets), <hi rend="ital">fiercely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferociously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruelly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barbarously</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n42240.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">saevē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeve et atrociter factitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gesturus impia bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 171</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42240.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">saevĭter</orth>: ferro cernunt de victoriā, Enn. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 511, 8</bibl>; Att. and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 4:7" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42240.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">saevum</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui arridens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:398" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 398</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:589" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 589</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 285</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42240.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina Gorgoneo saevius igne micant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 504</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 5, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42240.9" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt (loca), quae tepent hieme, sed aestate saevissime candent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; Claud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevissime dentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 64, § 170</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saga: <entryFree id="n42241" type="main" key="sa_ga1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sāga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. sāgus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42242" type="main" key="sa^ga2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. săgum <sense id="n42242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sagacitas: <entryFree id="n42243" type="main" key="sa^ga_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sagax</etym>, <sense id="n42243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">keenness of perception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acuteness of the senses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sagacity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42243.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42243.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Keenness of scent</hi> in dogs: <cit><quote lang="la">canum tam incredibilis ad investigandum sagacitas narium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">canum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 92</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42243.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of hunters: <cit><quote lang="la">ut domitas feras mentita sagacitate colligerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:81:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 81, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42243.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Keenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acuteness</hi> of the other senses: <cit><quote lang="la">sensuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:58" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42243.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">intellectual keenness of perception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acuteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewdness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sagacity</hi> (good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: sollertia, acumen): utrum admonitus ac tentatus, an, quā est ipse sagacitate in his rebus, sine duce ullo, sine indice, pervenerit ad hanc improbitatem, nescio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:41:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 41, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuam tantam fuisse sagacitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">29: erat eā sagacitate, ut decipi non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hipparchi sagacitate compertum est, lunae defectum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 13, 10, § 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sagaciter: <entryFree id="n42244" type="main" key="sa^ga_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sagax <sense id="n42244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi><</sense></entryFree>
sagalessos: <entryFree id="n42245" type="main" key="Sagalessos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sagalessos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sagalass-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an important town of Pisidia</hi>, whose ruins are found near the mod. <hi rend="ital">Aghtasan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 24, § 94</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sagalassēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sagalessos</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sagana: <entryFree id="n42246" type="main" key="sa^ga^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgăna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 622</bibl>, = saga, <sense id="n42246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female diviner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soothsayer; a wise woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witch;</hi> but occurs only as a <hi rend="ital">nom. prop.</hi> of a witch, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:25" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 25</bibl> and 48.</sense></entryFree>
saganos: <entryFree id="n42247" type="main" key="Saganos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saganos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sagano/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river of Carmania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 25, 28, § 110</bibl> (Jahn, Saccanas); called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Saganis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagapenon: <entryFree id="n42248" type="main" key="sa^ga^pe_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgăpēnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sacopenium.</entryFree>
sagaris: <entryFree id="n42249" type="main" key="Sa^ga^ris1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săgăris</orth>, is; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săgărĭus</orth>, ii; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Să-gĭārĭus</orth>, ii; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sangărĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Phrygia and Bitnynia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which empties into the Propontis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Sacari</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Sacaria.</hi>—Form Sagaris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 687 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sagarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 43, § 1</bibl></cit>: Sagiarius,<cb n="SAGI" />  v. 1. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sangarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 18, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42249.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săgărītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Sagaris</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nympha,</quote> <trans><tr>a nymph beloved by Attis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:229" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 229</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42249.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">San-gărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Sagaris</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Attis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:41" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42250" type="main" key="Sa^ga^ris2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săgăris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Trojan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 575</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagarius: <entryFree id="n42251" type="main" key="sa^ga_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sagum</etym>, <sense id="n42251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mantle</hi> (sagum; <cit><quote lang="la">post-class.): negotiatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:5:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:52" default="NO">17, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">NEGOCIATOR SAGARIVS,</quote> <trans><tr>a dealer in mantles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4251</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">SAGARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 283, 3472</bibl></cit>, and 4723.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n42252" type="main" key="Sa^ga^ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săgărĭus</orth>, v. 1. Sagaris.</entryFree>
sagatus: <entryFree id="n42253" type="main" key="sa^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sagum</etym>. <sense id="n42253.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">clothed in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">having on a</hi> sagum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 1, 2</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 538, 27</bibl> (opp. togati); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:11:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 11, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ant. Phil. 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42253.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">made of thick stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such as is proper for mantles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuculli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; and perh. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagax: <entryFree id="n42254" type="main" key="sa^gax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sagio; cf. salax, from salio</etym>, <sense id="n42254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of quick perception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose senses are acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sagacious</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n42254.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42254.2" n="A" level="2"> Chiefly of the acute sense of smelling in dogs, <hi rend="ital">keen-scented</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagax Nasum habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 207</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">catulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 201</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naris sagax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 829</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus venandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42254.3" n="B" level="2"> Of other senses: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitive canes canibusve sagacior anser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 599</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatum in gustu sagacissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 35, § 132</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42254.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">intellectually quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sagacious</hi> (syn.: sollers, perspicax, acutus, subtilis). </sense><sense id="n42254.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(homo) animal hoc providum, sagax, multiplex, acutum, memor, plenum rationis et consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 420</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1021" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 1021</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 840</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:913" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 913</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:369" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 369</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo sagax et astutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:87:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 87, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo circumspectus et sagax, modo inconsultus ac praeceps,</quote> <trans><tr>considerate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mire sagaces fallere hospites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 75</bibl></cit>.—Of a soothsayer, <hi rend="ital">knowing the future</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 316</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42254.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Ad aliquid (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad suspicandum sagacissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: ad haec pericula perspicienda, Plancus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42254.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">utilium sagax rerum et divina futuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibrarum et pennae divinarumque flammarum,</quote> <trans><tr>skilled in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:344" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 344</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigiorum (Joseph),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; and: rerum naturae, Col. praef., § 22 (with non ignarus). —</sense><sense id="n42254.8" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or simple <case>abl.</case> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir in conjecturis sagacissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas rimandis offensis sagax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">r</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagax quondam ventura videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 146</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">să-gācĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n42254.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keenly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with quickness of scent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a fine sense of smell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes si advenientem sagaciter odorantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultures sagacius odorantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 69, 88, § 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 50, § 137</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42254.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">acutely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewdly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sagaciously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagaciter pervestigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicere naturam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:57 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 57 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sagda: <entryFree id="n42255" type="main" key="sagda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sagda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of a leekgreen color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagena: <entryFree id="n42256" type="greek" key="sa^ge_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>,=<foreign lang="greek">sagh/nh,</foreign> <sense id="n42256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large fishing-net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a seine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 678</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:13:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 13, § 7</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">47, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 13, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42256.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a snare</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 12, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagenon: <entryFree id="n42257" type="foreign" key="sage_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sagēnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Indian</etym>, <sense id="n42257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of opal found in India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 46, § 130</bibl> (al. sangenon).</sense></entryFree>
sagina: <entryFree id="n42258" type="main" key="sa^gi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">sa/ttw,</foreign> to stuff full, to cram; v. sagmen</etym>, <sense id="n42258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stuffing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cramming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fattening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feasting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42258.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42258.2" n="A" level="2"> In abstr. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">anserum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:11" default="NO">8, 14, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 50, 71, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochlearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 56, 82, § 174</bibl></cit>: vaccarum. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 38, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies noctesque estur, Bibitur, neque quisquam parsimoniam adhibet: sagina plane est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in saginam se conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 96</bibl></cit>: qui multitudinem illam non auctoritate sed sagina tenebat,<cb n="SAGI" />  * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 71</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42258.3" n="B" level="2"> In concr. </sense><sense id="n42258.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nourishment</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n42258.5" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatoria sagina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 88</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of gladiators' food,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 25: <cit><quote lang="la">temulentus et sagina gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum laxare saginae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagina viva,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>small fish with which larger ones were fed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad saginam idonea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minuere saginam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad saginam pristinam revocare,</quote> <trans><tr>to natural food</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 148, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42258.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae viridis coma dulciore saginā roris aut fluminis,</quote> <trans><tr>rich nourishment</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit> Mai: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum forensibus certaminibus exercitatos et quasi militantes reficit ac reparat haec velut sagina dicendi,</quote> <trans><tr>nourishment of oratory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42258.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fatted animal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">este, effercite vos, saginam caedite,</quote> <trans><tr>kill the fatted beast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42258.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fatness</hi> produced by much eating, <hi rend="ital">corpulence</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">saginam corporis ex nimiā luxuriā contraxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagina ventris non homini sed beluae similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 38, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui colorem fuco et verum robur inani saginā mentiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio tendis mole saginam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ephem. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursam quae ceteris saginā corporis praevalebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 149, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saginarium: <entryFree id="n42259" type="main" key="sa^gi_na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgīnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sagina</etym>, <sense id="n42259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where animals are fatted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a feeding-stall</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saginatio: <entryFree id="n42260" type="main" key="sa^gi_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sagino</etym>, <sense id="n42260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fattening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stall-feeding</hi> (for the usual sagina), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saginatus: <entryFree id="n42261" type="main" key="sa^gi_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. sagino.</entryFree>
sagino: <entryFree id="n42262" type="main" key="sa^gi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgīno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sagina</etym> (class.; cf. educare). <sense id="n42262.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42262.1" n="A" level="2"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">to fatten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullos columbinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves ad sacrificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves offis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum hordeo ervoque (with roborare largo cibo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit>(5), 1, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glires fagi glande,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 7, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catulos ferarum molliore praedā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n42262.2" n="B" level="2"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to cram</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saginare plebem populares suos, ut jugulentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptialibus cenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra, quae copiā rerum omnium (illos Gallos) saginaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum exquisitis cottidie Antonius saginaretur epulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 10, 47, § 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42262.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to feed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nourish</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">terra multorum annorum frondibus et herbis, velut saginata largioribus pabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons umore supero saginatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45</bibl></cit>: qui ab illo pestifero ac perdito cive jampridem rei publicae sanguine saginantur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:36:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 36, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:39" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 42</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">săgīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fattened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fat</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">saginatior hostia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 21, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Christianus ursis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 15, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sagio: <entryFree id="n42263" type="hapax" key="sa_gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sāgĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root sagh-, to be sharp; Sanscr. saghnomi, kill; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sa/garis,</foreign> battle-axe; cf.: sagus, sagax, sagitta</etym>, <sense id="n42263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to perceive quickly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keenly</hi> by the senses; trop., <hi rend="ital">to perceive acutely</hi> with the intellect: sagire sentire acute est: ex quo sagae anus, quia multa scire volunt; <cit><quote lang="la">et sagaces dicti canes. Is igitur, qui ante sagit quam oblata res est, dicitur praesagire, id est futura ante sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sagitta: <entryFree id="n42264" type="main" key="sa^gitta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgitta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root sagh-; v. sagio</etym>. <sense id="n42264.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An arrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bolt</hi> (freq. in prose and poetry; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">telum, jaculum): cum arcum mihi et pharetram et sagittas sumpsero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confige sagittis fures thesaurarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:126 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 126 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">missiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittā Cupido cor meum transfixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1278</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:81" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 27, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittam conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervo aptare sagittas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 380</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">savii sagittis per cussus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit> (but the better reading is: ejus saviis perculsus).—</sense><sense id="n42264.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of things of a like form. </sense><sense id="n42264.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The extreme thin part of a vine-branch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:17:2" default="NO">3, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 156</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42264.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The herb arrow-head</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 68, § 111</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42264.4" n="C" level="2"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">an instrument for letting blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lancet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 25</bibl>, <pb n="1617" /> <cb n="SAGU" /> 5; 1, 43, 3, etc.—</sense><sense id="n42264.5" n="D" level="2"> Sagitta, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Arrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:15" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:14" default="NO">3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=382" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 382</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:309" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 31, 74, § 309</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagittarius: <entryFree id="n42265" type="main" key="sa^gitta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgittārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sagitta</etym>. <sense id="n42265.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an arrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrow-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus,</quote> <trans><tr>good for making arrows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <trans><tr>with arrows</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42265.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">săgittārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n42265.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An archer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bowman</hi>, a sort of light-armed troops, both foot and horse; usually in the <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19</bibl>; 7, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 5, 22</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">levis armatura cum equite sagittario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42265.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">săgittārii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">arrow-makers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrow-smiths</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42265.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation</hi> Sagittarius, or <hi rend="ital">the Archer</hi> (otherwise called Arcitenens], <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=525" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 525</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 124" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:26" default="NO">3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 36, § 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:97" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 11, 29, § 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagittatus: <entryFree id="n42266" type="main" key="sa^gitta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgittātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sagitto, II.</entryFree>
sagittifer: <entryFree id="n42267" type="main" key="sa^gitti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgittĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sagittafero</etym>. <sense id="n42267.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Arrow-bearing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pharetra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 468</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 416</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthi,</quote> <trans><tr>armed with arrows</tr>, <tr>archers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Geloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>the porcupine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Hystr. 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42267.1" n="II" level="1"> = Sagittarius, <hi rend="ital">the constellation of the Archer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 266</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 500</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 560</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagittiger: <entryFree id="n42268" type="main" key="Sa^gitti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săgittĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sagitta-gero</etym>, like Sagittifer (II.), for Sagittarius, <sense id="n42268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the constellation of the Archer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 482</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagittipotens: <entryFree id="n42269" type="main" key="Sa^gitti^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săgittĭ-pŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sagitta</etym>, for Sagittarius, <sense id="n42269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the constellation of the Archer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagitto: <entryFree id="n42270" type="main" key="sa^gitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgitto</orth>, no <sense id="n42270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n42270.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to discharge arrows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shoot with arrows</hi> (post-Aug. for sagittam jacere, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">hos equitare et sagittare docent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:42" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">63, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42270.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">săgittātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">shot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wounded with an arrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; Ambros. de Cain et Abel, 1, 5, 15.</sense></entryFree>
sagittula: <entryFree id="n42271" type="hapax" key="sa^gittu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgittŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little arrow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagma: <entryFree id="n42272" type="greek" key="sagma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sagma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/gma</foreign>, <sense id="n42272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pack-saddle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 59, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 15, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 16, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagmarius: <entryFree id="n42273" type="main" key="sagma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sagmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sagma</etym>, <sense id="n42273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a pack-saddle</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans><tr>a pack-horse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 4</bibl></cit>; Aur. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 7, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caballus, mula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sagmen: <entryFree id="n42274" type="main" key="sagmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sagmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root sag, to fill, feed; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sesagme/nos, sa/ttw</foreign>; Lat. sagina</etym>, <sense id="n42274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tuft of sacred herbs plucked within the citadel by the consul</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prœtor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by bearing which the persons of the Roman fetiales and ambassadors became inviolable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt sagmina quaedam herbae, quas legati populi Romani ferre solebant, ne quis eos violaret, sicuti legati Graecorum ferunt ea, quae vocantur cerycia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=320" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 320</bibl> Müll.; and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=321" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 321</bibl> ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 2, 3, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagochlamys: <entryFree id="n42275" type="greek" key="sa^gochla^mys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgochlămys</orth>, <itype>ydis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sagoxlamn/s</foreign>, <sense id="n42275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of military cloak</hi>, Val. Imp. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagra: <entryFree id="n42276" type="main" key="Sagra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sagra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sa/gras,</foreign> <sense id="n42276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Lower Italy</hi> (<hi rend="ital">of the Bruttii</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagulatus: <entryFree id="n42277" type="hapax" key="sa^gu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sagulum</etym>, <sense id="n42277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearing a</hi> sagulum: <cit><quote lang="la">comites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sagulum: <entryFree id="n42278" type="main" key="sa^gu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sagum</etym>, <sense id="n42278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small military cloak</hi> (usually the purple-colored one of the general), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 23, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:19" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 19</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 30, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 660</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:519" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 519</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:532" default="NO">17, 532</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagum: <entryFree id="n42279" type="greek" key="sa^gum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (ante-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">săgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, corresp. to the Greek, Enn. and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 223, 30 sq.</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 81</bibl> P.; <sense id="n42279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: sagas caerulas, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 81</bibl> P.; but it would perh. be more correct to read sagos caerulos; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 182, 54</bibl> Vahl.), = <foreign lang="greek">sa/gos</foreign> [acc. to Polybius, a Celtic word, whence the Engl. shag], <hi rend="ital">a coarse woollen blanket</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mantle</hi> (cf. laena), e. g. of servants, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the Germans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for horses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 42</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SAL" /> 4; 3, 15, 16; but most freq. of soldiers, <hi rend="ital">a military cloak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde metuo ne frigeas in hibernis ... praesertim qui sagis non abundares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saga fibulatoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Trig. Tyr. 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, saga is a sign of war (as toga is a sign of peace) in the phrases: </sense><sense id="n42279.1" n="a" level="4"> Saga sumere, <hi rend="ital">to put on the</hi> saga, i.q. <hi rend="ital">to take up arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare for battle</hi> (it was the custom for all Romans to do this, in token of preparation for war, even those who were not going to the field, excepting persons of consular rank; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 32</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 538, 27</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">tumultum decerni, justitium edici, saga sumi dico oportere, delectum habere, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 12, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā marique victus hostis punico Lugubre mutavit sagum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 28</bibl></cit>; in <number>sing.</number>, of an individual: <cit><quote lang="la">tum iste (Verres) excitatus sagum sumit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:36:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 36, § 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42279.2" n="b" level="4"> In the same signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad saga ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:16:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 16, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42279.3" n="c" level="4"> In sagis esse, <hi rend="ital">to be under arms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum est in sagis civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42279.4" n="d" level="4"> Saga ponere, <hi rend="ital">to lay down one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s arms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42279.5" n="II" level="1"> In gen. (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">a covering.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42279.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A curtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tent-cover</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 26, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">36, 14</bibl>, etc.— </sense><sense id="n42279.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A garment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 3, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saguntum: <entryFree id="n42280" type="main" key="Sa^guntum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săguntum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săguntus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sa/gounton,</foreign> <sense id="n42280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">on the Mediterranean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond the Iberus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the besieging and reduction of which by Hannibal led to the breaking out of the second Punic war;</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Murviedro.</hi>—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 350</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:83" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 83</bibl>;
