<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:3 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 3 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Graia Saguntos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:178" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 178</bibl></cit>.—Doubtful form, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 79, § 216</bibl> et saep. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săguntīnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Săguntĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 2, 22</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Saguntum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Saguntine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutum (from which utensils were made),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:6:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:108" default="NO">14, 108</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lagena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:29" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săguntīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people of Saguntum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Saguntines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 6</bibl> sq.; Auct. B. Hisp. 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sagus: <entryFree id="n42281" type="main" key="sa_gus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sāgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>v. sagio; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 65</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=255" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 255</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n42281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">presaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predicting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi> (as <pos>adj.</pos>, only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clangores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 8, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">MANVS,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>magical</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2486</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42281.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> (freq. and class.): <orth extent="full" lang="la">sāga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female diviner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wise woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortune-teller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothsayer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 65</bibl> (v. the passage under sagio); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:22" default="NO">11, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:42" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:59" default="NO">1, 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 24, 10.—And, because such women often acted as panders, </sense><sense id="n42281.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bawd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procuress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagae mulieres dicuntur feminae ad libidinem virorum indagatrices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 22, 33</bibl></cit>: ut saga et bona conciliatrix, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 23, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saga conducta pretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0146,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>Turp.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n42282" type="main" key="sa^gus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. sagum.</entryFree>
sais: <entryFree id="n42283" type="main" key="Sa^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săïs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sa/i(s,</foreign> <sense id="n42283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of Lower Egypt</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sa el-Hajar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 64</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42283.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sai(ths,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sais</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Saitic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(nomos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 49</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sais</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42283.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săĭ_tĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Sais</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Saitic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(charta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saitae: <entryFree id="n42284" type="main" key="Sa^i_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. Sais, A.</entryFree>
sal: <entryFree id="n42285" type="main" key="sal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sal</orth>, <itype>sălis</itype> (<sense id="n42285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form of the <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĕ</orth>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26</bibl>, or Ann. v. 378 Vahl.; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 223, 17</bibl>; also, in the regular form sometimes <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> in <number>sing.</number>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, I.; but <number>plur.</number> always <itype>sales</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, 697 sq.; <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi>: infusis salis, Fabian. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 82</bibl> P.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root sal-, to stream, flow; cf. <foreign lang="greek">a(/ls</foreign>; perh. also found in insula, salix</etym>. </sense><sense id="n42285.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">salt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42285.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42285.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>: ex sale, qui apud Carthaginienses fit, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 659</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">salem candidum sic facito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:6" default="NO">8, 6</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 12, 6, 2; 12, 21, 2 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 25</bibl>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <cb n="SALA" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 82</bibl> P., and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 644</bibl> ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 46</bibl> et saep.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">salem cum pane edit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 8, 41, § 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42285.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: nunc vides in conviviis ita poni et sal et mel, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 82</bibl> P.; so, aliud, Fabian. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 82</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">tritum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 24, 4 al.</bibl></cit>; v. also infra, II.—</sense><sense id="n42285.5" n="(g)" level="5"> Doubtful <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos modios salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(caseum) parco sale reponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 403</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis vendendi arbitrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 42, § 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42285.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin aspergi solent sales: melior fossilis quam marinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:6:1" default="NO">8, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 9, 2</bibl> Mai; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nov. 19</bibl>; Fabian. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 82</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 286</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42285.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42285.8" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the salt water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42285.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.: <cit><quote lang="la">supra rorem salis edita pars est remorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sale tabentes artus in litore ponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 385</bibl>; 5, 848; 5, 866; 6, 697; 10, 214; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:70" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:722" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 722</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42285.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sales amari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequorei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 257</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42285.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A speck on precious stones shaped like a grain of salt.</hi>—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 22, § 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:117" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 8, 37, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 2, 10, § 28</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 8, § 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42285.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42285.13" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Intellectual acuteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewdness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facetiousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sarcasm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a witticism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witty saying</hi> (class. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: lepos, facetiae, festivitas): (sal) adeo necessarium elementum est, ut transierit intellectus ad voluptates animi quoque. Nam ita sales appellantur, omnisque vitae lepos et summa hilaritas laborumque requies non alio magis vocabulo constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 88</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n42285.14" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui habet salem, quod in te est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla venustas, Nulla in tam magno est corpore mica salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:86:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 86, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar inusitatum nostris oratoribus leporem quendam et salem est consecutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:29:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 29, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sale vero et facetiis Caesar vicit omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 37, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(litterae) tum humanitatis sparsae sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (versus) dum denique habent salem ac leporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Scipio omnes sale facetiisque superabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 128</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">argutiae facetissimi salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis satis est, sannionum parum, Cic Fam. 9, 16, 10: in quo mihi videtur specimen fuisse humanitatis, salis, suavitatis, leporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Tusc. 5:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Lucilius) sale multo Urbem defricuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: acerbitas et abundantia salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:94" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic delectatur iambis, Ille Bioneïs sermonibus et sale nigro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>biting wit</tr>, <tr>sarcasm</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 13, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui plurimum in scribendo et salis haberet et fellis nec candoris minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 21, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42285.15" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (ante-class.): quicquid loquitur, sal merum est, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 659</bibl> P.; so, (puella) <foreign lang="greek">*xari/twn mi/a,</foreign> tota merum sal, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42285.16" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani veteres atque urbani sales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestri proavi Plautinos Laudavere sales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 27:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 27, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculosi sales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libaboque tuos, scite Menandre, sales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 28: <cit><quote lang="la">huic generi orationis aspergentur etiam sales, qui in dicendo minimum quantum valent: quorum duo genera sunt, unum facetiarum, alterum dicacitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 26, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:117" default="NO">10, 1, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ciceronem) in salibus aliquando frigidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a salibus suffusis felle refugi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:565" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protervi sales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salibus vehemens intra pomoeria natis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42285.17" n="B" level="2"> (Borrowed from the use of salt as a relish.) <hi rend="ital">Good taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum antiquitus constitutum plus salis quam sumptūs habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42285.18" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sharpness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pungency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incentive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (sc. calor, sanguis) aviditatem naturali sale augent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 72, 93, § 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salacaccabia: <entryFree id="n42286" type="greek" key="sa^la^cacca^bi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălăcaccăbĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a(lakakka/bia</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n42286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">salted food boiled in a pot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:1:section=116" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 1, § 116</bibl> (al. sala cottabia).</sense></entryFree>
salacia: <entryFree id="n42287" type="main" key="Sa^la_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>salum</etym>. <sense id="n42287.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The goddess of the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Neptune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=72" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 72</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 22; an old form of prayer in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11</bibl>; Fest. pp. 326 and 327 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157, 1 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n42287.1" n="II" level="1"> An appellation for <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi>: saevitiam Salaciae fugimus, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 1</bibl>. 1. (Trag. Rel. p. 112 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
salacitas: <entryFree id="n42288" type="main" key="sa^la_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>salax</etym>, <sense id="n42288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salaciousness</hi>:<pb n="1618" /> <cb n="SALA" />  passeris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 26, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:107" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 36, 52, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:161" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 59, 79, § 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salaco: <entryFree id="n42289" type="greek" key="sa^la^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălăco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sala/kwn,</foreign> <sense id="n42289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swaggerer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">braggart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 24, 2</bibl> (perh. also <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 18, 2</bibl>, acc. to the conject. of Manut.; v. Inscr. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>, where others read Halico).</sense></entryFree>
salamandra: <entryFree id="n42290" type="greek" key="sa^la^mandra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălămandra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">salama/ndra,</foreign> <sense id="n42290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a salamander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:188 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 67, 86, § 188 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:74" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 23, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:66:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 66, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 107 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
salambo: <entryFree id="n42291" type="main" key="Sa^lambo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălambo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of love among the Babylonians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salaminiacus: <entryFree id="n42292" type="main" key="Sa^la^mi_ni^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălămīnĭăcus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălămīnĭus</orth>, v. Salamis.</entryFree>
salamis: <entryFree id="n42293" type="main" key="Sa^la^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălămis</orth>, <itype>īnis</itype> (a Latinized collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălămīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:7:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3:2" default="NO">44, 3, 2</bibl>; and acc. to MSS., <case>acc.</case> Salaminam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 110</bibl>; cf. Eleusinam, s. v. Eleusin), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*salami/s.</foreign> <sense id="n42293.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The island of Salamis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Saronic Gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite Eleusis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kuluri</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Salamis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 62</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Salamine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl>; Gr. <case>acc.</case> Salamina, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 193</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 99 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 21</bibl>: Salaminem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 259, 26</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 370 Rib.).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42293.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Să-lămīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the island of Salamis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tropaeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 110</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Teucer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 23</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălămīnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Salamis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 208</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42293.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălămīnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Salamis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tropaea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:282" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 282</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42293.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The city of Salamis in Cyprus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded by Teucer of the island of Salamis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 760</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Salamina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 130</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42293.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălămīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Salamis in Cyprus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <trans><tr>worshipped there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae,</quote> <trans><tr>lying opposite to the city of Salamis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 130</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălămīnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the Cyprian Salamis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salapia: <entryFree id="n42294" type="main" key="Sa^la^pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălăpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (also contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălpia</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">*salpi/a,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> B. Civ. 1, 52</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Daunian Apulia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Salpi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 28</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42294.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălăpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălpīnus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 377</bibl> Cort. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălpīni</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Salapia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Salapian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 377</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălăpīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Salapia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Salapians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:27:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 27, 71</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42294.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălăpĭtāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = Salapini, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Salapia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salapitta: <entryFree id="n42295" type="main" key="sa^la^pitta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălăpitta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>alapa</etym>, <sense id="n42295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a box on the ear</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 329</bibl>; v. Oehler ad h. 1.; and cf. salapitta, <foreign lang="greek">r(a/pisma,</foreign> Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
salaputium: <entryFree id="n42296" type="main" key="sa^la^pu_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălăpūtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, a humorous appellation for <sense id="n42296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tiny man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a manikin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Liliputian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di magni, salaputium disertum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 53, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
salar: <entryFree id="n42297" type="main" key="sa^lar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălar</orth>, <itype>ăris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of trout</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 128</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
salarianus: <entryFree id="n42298" type="main" key="Sa^la_ri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălārĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <sense id="n42298.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">castanea,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of chestnut</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salariarius: <entryFree id="n42299" type="main" key="sa^la_ri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălārĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>salarium</etym>, <sense id="n42299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who receives pay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">salary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a salaried person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:10:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 10, § 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3507</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4074</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salarium: <entryFree id="n42300" type="main" key="sa^la_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. salarius, II. B.</entryFree>
salarius: <entryFree id="n42301" type="main" key="sa^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>sal</etym>. <sense id="n42301.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to salt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salt-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annona,</quote> <trans><tr>the yearly revenue from the sale of salt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42301.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj. prop.</hi>: Salaria Via, <hi rend="ital">the road beginning at the</hi> Porta Collina, <hi rend="ital">and leading into the country of the Sabines</hi>, so called because the Sabines fetched salt by it from the sea, <hi rend="ital">the Salt Road</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 89</bibl>; Fest. s. h. v. p. 326 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:1:6" default="NO">3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:2:14" default="NO">3, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called Salaria (sc. via),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42301.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42301.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in salted fish</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:86:9" default="NO">4, 86, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">CORPVS SALARIORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1092</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42301.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. argentum; cf.: calcearium, congiarium, vestiarium, etc.); orig., <hi rend="ital">the money given to the soldiers for salt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salt-money;</hi> hence, post-Aug. (v. Dio Cass. 52, 23, and 78, 22), in gen., <hi rend="ital">a pension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allowance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salary</hi> (cf.: honorarium, annuum, merces, stipendium): (sal) honoribus etiam <cb n="SALG" /> militiaeque interponitur, salariis inde dictis, magnă apud antiquos auctoritate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 89</bibl>: non pudet tribunorum militarium salariis emere (candelabra), i.e. <hi rend="ital">for as much as the</hi> salarium <hi rend="ital">of a military tribune amounts to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 3, 6, § 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:132" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salarii loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comites salario sustentare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatorum nobilissimo cuique ... annua salaria constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">salarium proconsulari solitum offerri Agricolae non dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salarium annuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8:section=23" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 15, 8, § 23</bibl></cit>; hence, <hi rend="ital">a meal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam salarium dandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salassi: <entryFree id="n42302" type="main" key="Salassi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Salassi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Alpine tribe in the modern Savoy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:182 al" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 20, 49, § 182 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
salax: <entryFree id="n42303" type="main" key="sa^lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>salio; cf. sagax, from sagio</etym>. <sense id="n42303.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fond of leaping</hi>, esp. of male animals, <hi rend="ital">lustful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lecherous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">galli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:771" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 771</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salaciora animalia, Lact. Opif. Dei, 14: salacissimi mares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:9" default="NO">8, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—Vulgarly applied to Priapus: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">34, 1</bibl>; and sarcastically: salacissimus Juppiter, Sen. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 16, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42303.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">that provokes lust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provocative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erucae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 799</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bulbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:75:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 75, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba, i.e. eruca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 422</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sale: <entryFree id="n42304" type="main" key="sa^le^1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĕ</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. sal <sense id="n42304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42305" type="main" key="Sa^le2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n42305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake in Lydia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salebra: <entryFree id="n42306" type="main" key="sa^le^_bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĕ_bra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (orig. <pos>adj.</pos>, sc. via), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>salio</etym>, <sense id="n42306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jolting-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi> in a road. </sense><sense id="n42306.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">demonstrant astra salebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit> (4, 15), 15; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:58:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 58, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salebris sollicitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42306.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">senile guttur salebris spiritŭs praegravavit,</quote> <trans><tr>irregular breathing</tr>, <tr>panting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12</bibl></cit>, ext. 6.—</sense><sense id="n42306.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42306.4" n="A" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruggedness</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">proclivi currit oratio: venit ad extremum: haeret in salebră,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>it sticks fast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herodotus sine ullis salebris fluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam in tantas salebras incidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:90:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 90, 2</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n42306.5" n="B" level="2"> Salebra tristitiae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a cloud of sadness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9</bibl>, ext. 5.</sense></entryFree>
salebratus: <entryFree id="n42307" type="hapax" key="sa^le^_bra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĕ_brātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>salebra</etym>, <sense id="n42307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rugged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obices saxorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salebritas: <entryFree id="n42308" type="main" key="sa^le^_bri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĕ_brĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ruggedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salebrosity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inaccessa (saxi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 178, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salebrosus: <entryFree id="n42309" type="main" key="sa^le^_bro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĕ_brōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of joltings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uneven</hi> (not anteAug.; cf.: confragosus, horridus, asper). </sense><sense id="n42309.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">semita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furfures multo lapide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 194, 38.—</sense><sense id="n42309.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">resistens ac salebrosa oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositio Pollionis Asinii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 7</bibl></cit>.—Of the writer himself: <cit><quote lang="la">Sanctra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saleius: <entryFree id="n42310" type="main" key="Sa^le_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălēĭus</orth> <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, a Roman name, e. g. Saleius Bassus, <sense id="n42310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inferior poet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 519</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salentini: <entryFree id="n42311" type="main" key="Sa_lenti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sālentīni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sall-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n42311.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people of Calabria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the south-eastern extremity of Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 1</bibl>.—Also used to designate <hi rend="ital">the country of the Salentines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Salentinis aut in Bruttiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in Salentinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42311.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sālentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Salentine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 400</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promontorium,</quote> <trans><tr>the south-eastern point of Italy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 23, 26, § 145</bibl>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. 1</bibl>. 1.: <cit><quote lang="la">Neretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:575" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 575</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salernum: <entryFree id="n42312" type="main" key="Sa^lernum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălernum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n42312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maritime town in the Picentine territory</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Salerno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:45" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 425</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălernitānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Salernian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latebra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 5, § 25</bibl></cit> (Jahn, Salurnitanus): <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42312.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Să-lernus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Salernum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:853" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 853</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salgama: <entryFree id="n42313" type="greek" key="salga^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salgăma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a(/lmh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n42313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pickles</hi> preserved in brine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:117" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:4" default="NO">12, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9:2" default="NO">12, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salgamarius: <entryFree id="n42314" type="main" key="salga^ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salgămārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>salgama</etym>, <sense id="n42314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sells pickles</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a(lmeuth/s,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:56:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 56, 1</bibl>.—Hence, Salgamarius, <hi rend="ital">the title of</hi> <cb n="SALI" /> <hi rend="ital">a treatise by C. Matius on pickling fruits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:46:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 46, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salgamum: <entryFree id="n42315" type="main" key="salga^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salgămum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>salgama</etym>, <sense id="n42315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nourish-ment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustenance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 42</bibl>; Cod. Th. 7, 9, § 1 sq.</sense></entryFree>
salganea: <entryFree id="n42316" type="main" key="Salgane^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Salganĕa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n42316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Euripus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:46" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:51" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saliaris: <entryFree id="n42317" type="main" key="Sa^li^a_ris1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălĭāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. Salii</etym>. <sense id="n42317.0" n="I" level="1"> Of or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> Salii (priests of Mars), <hi rend="ital">Salian</hi>: Numae carmen, <hi rend="ital">which Numa directed the</hi> Salii <hi rend="ital">to chant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42317.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of banquets (because of the sumptuous feasts which were given at the Salian processions), <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (Saliis) per omnes dies, ub cumque manent, quia amplae ponuntur cenae: si quae aliae magnae fiunt, Saliares appellantur, Fest. s. v. Salios, p. 326 Müll.: dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 192, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 152, 30; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum epulati essemus Saliarem in modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42318" type="main" key="Sa^li^a_ris2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălĭāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. salio</etym>: <sense id="n42318.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">insulae,</quote> <trans><tr>dancing islands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 95, 96, § 209</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saliatus: <entryFree id="n42319" type="main" key="Sa^li^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. Salii</etym>, <sense id="n42319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignity of a</hi> Salius (priest of Mars), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:34, p. 265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 34, p. 265</bibl> Orell.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ant. Phil. 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
salicastrum: <entryFree id="n42320" type="main" key="sa^li^castrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭcastrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>salictum</etym>, <sense id="n42320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wild vine found in willow-thickets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 15, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salictarius: <entryFree id="n42321" type="main" key="sa^licta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălictārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n42321.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to willows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willow-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of wild hop that grows in willowgrounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 50, § 86</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42321.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălictārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who takes care of willow-trees</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salictum: <entryFree id="n42322" type="main" key="sa^lictum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from salicetum, from salix</etym>, <sense id="n42322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plantation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thicket of willows</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">33, 5</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 40 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 14, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 415</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 363</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salientes: <entryFree id="n42323" type="main" key="sa^li^entes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭentes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. 2. <itype>salio</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
salifodina: <entryFree id="n42324" type="main" key="sa^li^fo^di_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭ-fŏdīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sal-fodina</etym>, <sense id="n42324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a saltpit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3, p. 235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, p. 235</bibl> Bip.</sense></entryFree>
saligneus: <entryFree id="n42325" type="main" key="sa^ligne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălignĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. salignus <sense id="n42325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
salignus: <entryFree id="n42326" type="main" key="sa^lignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălignus</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălignĕus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:12" default="NO">9, 15, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:33" default="NO">11, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:7:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 7, 3</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>salix</etym>, <sense id="n42326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of willow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">willowwood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willow-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fustis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:363" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 659</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:657" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 657</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbonum crates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salii: <entryFree id="n42327" type="main" key="Sa^li^i1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. salio; hence, prop., the Leapers, Jumpers</etym>, <sense id="n42327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a college of priests at Rome dedicated by Numa to the service of Mars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armed and bearing the</hi> ancilia (v. ancile), <hi rend="ital">with songs and dances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made solemn processions every year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the first half of March</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about the city and its sacred places.</hi> Their songs, being in an obsolete language, were almost unintelligible in the class. per.: <cit><quote lang="la">Salii a salitando, quod facere in Comitio in sacris quotannis et solent et debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=85" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 85</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:260 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 260 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; Fest. s. h. v. p. 326 Müll.; id. s. v. axamenta, p. 3 ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:51:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 51, 197</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saliūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 663</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:20" default="NO">1, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 4</bibl>.—In Tibur such Salii were <hi rend="ital">priests of Hercules</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 285</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2249</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2761</bibl>; and v. axamenta; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also in Virg. (ubertate doctrinae altioris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 1.1</bibl></cit>.), introduced as priests of Hercules, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 285</bibl>.—There were also in Alba such Salii, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2247</bibl> and 2248.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">SALIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2242 sq.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Să-lĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n42327.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> Salii: <cit><quote lang="la">Salias virgines Cincius ait esse conducticias, quae ad Salios adhibeantur, cum apicibus paludatas, quas Aelius Stilo scripsit sacrificium facere in regiā cum pontifice paludatas cum apicibus in modum Saliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=329" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 329</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Marquardt 1. 1. p. 374.—</sense><sense id="n42327.2" n="2" level="3"> (=Saliaris, II.) <hi rend="ital">Sumptuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saliae (sc. epulae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42328" type="main" key="Sa^li^i2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Salians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a part of the Franks</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 8, 3</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 222</bibl>. <pb n="1619" /> <cb n="SALI" /></sense></entryFree>
salillum: <entryFree id="n42329" type="main" key="sa^lillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>for salinulum, from salinum</etym>, <sense id="n42329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little salt-cellar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 19</bibl>.—In comic lang.: salillum animae, perh. <hi rend="ital">little measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief span of life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salinae: <entryFree id="n42330" type="main" key="sa^li_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălīnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> <etym>sal</etym> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=48" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 48</bibl> Müll.), <gen>f.</gen> (sc. fodinae), <sense id="n42330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">salt-works</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saltpits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:53:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 53, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:15 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 15 sq.</bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">Salinae Romanae,</quote> <trans><tr>the salt-works established by Ancus Martius at Ostia</tr>, <tr>near Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 33</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called simply Salinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 47</bibl>: Herculeae, <hi rend="ital">near Herculaneum</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 135.—In a play upon the meaning of this word and that of sal, II.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod parum diligenter possessio salinarum mearum a te procuratore defenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 32, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42330.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălīnae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">nom. prop.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42330.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The saltworks at Ostia</hi>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>.—</sense><sense id="n42330.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A square in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the</hi> Porta Trigemina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
salinarius: <entryFree id="n42331" type="hapax" key="sa^li_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>salinae</etym>, <sense id="n42331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to salt-works</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">areae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salinator: <entryFree id="n42332" type="main" key="sa^li_na_tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălīnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dealer in salt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a salter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 749</bibl>: aerarii, <hi rend="ital">a farmer of the salt-revenue</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 244</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42333" type="main" key="Sa^li_na_tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălīnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. salinator</etym>, <sense id="n42333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 273</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 24 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
salinum: <entryFree id="n42334" type="main" key="sa^li_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sal</etym> (sc. vas; <sense id="n42334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form, <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălīni</orth>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 546, 14</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a salt-cellar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:25" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:138" default="NO">5, 138</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also used at sacrifices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 91</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">salinum cum sale obsignare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salio: <entryFree id="n42335" type="main" key="sa^li^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sall-</orth>), no <sense id="n42335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ītum, 4 (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sallo</orth>, no <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, salsum, 3: salunt, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 372</bibl> P.: salerent, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 909</bibl>: salere, Lucil. ib.: salsurus, Mummius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 910</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> salsus, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> <pos>P. a.</pos>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n42335.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To salt down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to salt</hi>: pernas, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleas caducas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: pisces, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 909</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>: saliturus istaec mittam salem, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 910</bibl> P.: saliti pumiliones, Corn. Sev. ib.; so in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: caro salita, Fabian. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 372</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">thynnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:32:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 32, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 16, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42335.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sprinkle</hi> before sacrifice (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnis victima sale salietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 9, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">igne salietur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">salsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">salted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42335.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc salsum'st,</quote> <trans><tr>is too salt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:59:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 59, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges (as a sacrifice),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 133</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">farra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:284" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 284</bibl></cit> (v. mola): <cit><quote lang="la">(gravidae) salsioribus cibis usae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 6, 5, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsissimus sal qui siccissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 85</bibl></cit>.—A <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of the sea, of blood, of tears, etc., <hi rend="ital">salt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briny</hi>: mare, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 453 Vahl.); id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 183, 19</bibl> (Trag. v. 145 ib.); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 493</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:634" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 634</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e salso momine ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 891</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:894" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 894</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 482</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, comically, of shipwrecked persons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 33</bibl>: sanguis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 168 Vahl.); Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 192, 2</bibl>: heu! qui salsis fluctibus mandet me? id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 19</bibl> (Trag. v. 562 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1,125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:920" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 920</bibl>; cf.: guttae lacrimarum, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 503, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sputa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubigo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 220</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">salsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">salted things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salted food</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 32</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> salsissimus;
