<cit><quote lang="la">hence, mare salsissimum,</quote> <trans><tr>the Dead Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 34, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n42335.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to sal, II.), <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facetious</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">facetus, dicax, lepidus, urbanus): accedunt non Attici, sed salsiores quam illi Atticorum, Romani veteres atque urbani sales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus est perelegans et cum gravitate salsum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:270 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 270 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 63, 255</bibl>; 2, 56, 228; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 90</bibl>: salsum in consuetudine pro ridiculo tantum accepimus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:18 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 18 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:39" default="NO">6, 3, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salso multoque fluenti (sermone) regerit convicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 65</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inveni ridicula et salsa multa Graecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 217</bibl></cit>: De <foreign lang="greek">*hrakleidei/w(</foreign> Varronis, negotia salsa, <hi rend="ital">are humorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merry stories</hi>, <cb n="SALI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">esse quamvis facetum atque salsum, non nimis est per se ipsum invidendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 228</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 17, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">salsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">wittily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acutely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facetiously</hi> (acc. to B.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 275</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:30" default="NO">6, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:89" default="NO">6, 3, 89</bibl>; 6, 3, 101. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> salsissime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 221</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42336" type="main" key="sa^li^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 371</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 906</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 416</bibl>: <sense id="n42336.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">salii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:210" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 210</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 9, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 2:20:section=31" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 2, 20, § 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salivi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 384</bibl></cit>), saltum, 4 (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part. pres.</hi> salientum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1200</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [kindr. with Sanscr. sar-, sal-, to go, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(/llomai;</foreign> cf. salax]. </sense><sense id="n42336.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jump</hi> (cf. tripudio), <hi rend="ital">hop.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42336.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ambulant aliquae (aves), ut cornices: saliunt aliae, ut passeres, merulae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 38, 54, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saliendo sese exercebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamo salientes ducere pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexare uterum pueris salientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:599" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 599</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">saxo salire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de muro (with praecipitari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 24</bibl></cit>: praecipites in puteum, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 725</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">in aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:554" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super scuta,</quote> <trans><tr>on the shields</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra Limites clientium Salis avarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saliet, tundet pede terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salias terrae gravis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per praecipitia et praerupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per flammas saluisse pecus, saluisse colonos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:805" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 805</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unctos saluere per utres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio cum saluere foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 52: <cit><quote lang="la">saliunt in gurgite ranae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 381</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42336.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: ut habeat lacum, ubi aqua saliat, <hi rend="ital">leaps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flows down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in culleum de dolio vinum salire possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personae e quarum rostris aqua salire solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae salientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 9 al" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 9 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua saliens,</quote> <trans><tr>spring-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 4, 14</bibl></cit>; v. also infra, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa in tectis crepitans salit horrida grando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 449</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">grando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">farre pio placant et saliente sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">farre pio et saliente micā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">farra micaeque salientis honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:409" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4,409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor salit,</quote> <trans><tr>leaps</tr>, <tr>beats</tr>, <tr>palpitates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:111" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 708" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 708</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 460</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora trepido motu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:390" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temptatae pollice venae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 289</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 20, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e terrāque exorta repente arbusta salirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 187</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42336.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena negotia centum Per caput et circa saliunt latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42336.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, of the copulation of animals, <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:4:8" default="NO">2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:7:8" default="NO">2, 7, 8</bibl> sq.; 3, 6, 3; 3, 10, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 485</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1196</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭentes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. aquae), <hi rend="ital">springs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fountains</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:87" default="NO">87</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 103; 104; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:15 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 15 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
salipotens: <entryFree id="n42337" type="hapax" key="sa^li^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭ-pŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n42337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that rules the salt sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater Jovis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Neptune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
salisatio: <entryFree id="n42338" type="main" key="sa^li^sa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭsātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">salissātĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saliso, whence also salisator</etym>, <sense id="n42338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leaping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cordis (with pulsus),</quote> <trans><tr>a beating</tr>, <tr>palpitating</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: salisatio, <foreign lang="greek">palmo/s,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
salisatores: <entryFree id="n42339" type="gloss" key="sa^li^sa_to_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭsātōres</orth> <itype>vocati sunt, quia dum eis membrorum quaecumque partes salierint, aliquid sibi exinde prosperum seu triste significari praedicunt</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 9, 26</bibl> (v. Theocriti Idyll. 3, 37, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 105</bibl>) [saliso, whence also salisatio].</entryFree>
salisubsuli: <entryFree id="n42340" type="main" key="Sa^li^subsu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălĭsubsŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Salii-subsilio</etym>, a word comically formed by Cat., to signify <sense id="n42340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dancing priests of Mars</hi> (v. Salii), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salitio: <entryFree id="n42341" type="hapax" key="sa^li_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. salio</etym>, <sense id="n42341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leaping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <trans><tr>on horseback</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salito: <entryFree id="n42342" type="hapax" key="sa^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. salto <sense id="n42342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
salitura: <entryFree id="n42343" type="hapax" key="sa^li_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălītūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. salio</etym>, <sense id="n42343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a salting down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 21, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salitus: <entryFree id="n42344" type="main" key="sa^li_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of 1. salio.</entryFree>
saliunca: <entryFree id="n42345" type="main" key="sa^li^unca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭunca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an odoriferous plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Celtic nard</hi>: Valeriana Celtica, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 20, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 195" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:258" default="NO">258</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:55:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 55, 13</bibl>. <cb n="SALM" /></sense></entryFree>
saliuncula: <entryFree id="n42346" type="main" key="sa^li^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dim. of saliunca</etym>, <sense id="n42346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an odoriferous plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 15, 55</bibl>; v. 12 and 13.</sense></entryFree>
salius: <entryFree id="n42346.1" type="gloss" key="Sa^li^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. 1. Salii.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n42347" type="main" key="Sa^li^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. 2. Salii.</entryFree>
saliva: <entryFree id="n42348" type="main" key="sa^li_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">si/alon</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n42348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spittle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saliva</hi> (in gen., while sputum is that already spit out; equally used in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n42348.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:78:8" default="NO" valid="yes">78, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:99:10" default="NO" valid="yes">99, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:623" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 623</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:38:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 38, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 6, 24, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:193" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 12, 53, § 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in manum ingerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:37 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 37 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 638</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1108" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unā salivā,</quote> <trans><tr>without interruption</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Pam. 61, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42348.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a spittle-like moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochlearum,</quote> <trans><tr>slime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 47, § 136</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ostrearum, id, 32, 6, 21, § 60: purpurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 36, 60, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 147</bibl></cit>: siderum (<hi rend="ital">honey-dew</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 12, 12, § 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42348.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flavor; longing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appetite</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Methymnaei Graia saliva meri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 38; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suo cuique vino saliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercurialis,</quote> <trans><tr>for gain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:112" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turdarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna tibi salivam movet,</quote> <trans><tr>makes your mouth water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 79:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 79, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid (sc. vinum) ad salivam facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 48, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salivarius: <entryFree id="n42349" type="main" key="sa^li_va_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălīvārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saliva, I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n42349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slimy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clammy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentor (muricum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 160</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salivatio: <entryFree id="n42350" type="main" key="sa^li_va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălīvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>salivo, II.</etym>, in the later med. lang., <sense id="n42350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">salivation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:2 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
salivatum: <entryFree id="n42351" type="main" key="sa^li_va_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălīvātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. salivo <sense id="n42351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
salivo: <entryFree id="n42352" type="main" key="sa^li_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălīvo</orth>, no <sense id="n42352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>saliva</etym>. * </sense><sense id="n42352.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To spit out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentorem cujusdam cerae (purpurae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 36, 60, § 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42352.2" n="II" level="1"> In veterinary lang., <hi rend="ital">to salivate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cure by salivation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrotum pecus, vaccam, admissarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:9" default="NO">6, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:24:5" default="NO">5, 24, 5</bibl>; 6, 37, 9; <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 7</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">să-līvātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">a medicine employed to excite the flow of saliva</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 76, § 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salivosus: <entryFree id="n42353" type="main" key="sa^li_vo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălīvōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n42353.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of spittle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slavering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrotans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n42353.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Slimy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clammy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor (corticis ulmorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 38, 72, § 181</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salix: <entryFree id="n42354" type="main" key="sa^lix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n42354.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a willow-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sallow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 68, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:56" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9, 37, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 361</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 16</bibl> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n42354.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a willowbranch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">osier</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">ste*f.</foreign> 10, 703.</sense></entryFree>
sallentini: <entryFree id="n42355" type="main" key="Sallenti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sallentīni</orth>, v. Salentini.</entryFree>
sallio: <entryFree id="n42356" type="main" key="salli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sallĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. 1. salio.</entryFree>
sallo: <entryFree id="n42357" type="main" key="sallo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sallo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. 1. salio.</entryFree>
sallustianus: <entryFree id="n42358" type="main" key="Sallusti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sallustĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sallustius, I. and III.</entryFree>
sallustius: <entryFree id="n42359" type="main" key="Sallusti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sallustĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Salustĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Sallust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42359.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Sallustius Crispus, <hi rend="ital">the celebrated Roman historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:101" default="NO">10, 1, 101</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sallustĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Salust-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">like Sallust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sallustian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa brevitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:32" default="NO">10, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sallustĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an imitator of Sallust</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sallustianum illud,</quote> <trans><tr>that expression of Sallust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sallustĭā-nē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of Sallust</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1022</bibl> P —</sense><sense id="n42359.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A client of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 28, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 11 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42359.3" n="III" level="1"> Crispus Sallustius, <hi rend="ital">a grand-nephew of the historian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famed for his great wealth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 48</bibl>. The Sallustiani horti are named after him, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 16, § 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1369</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, Sallustianum aes,</quote> <trans><tr>gained from his mines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42359.4" n="IV" level="1"> Cn. Sallustius, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salluvii: <entryFree id="n42360" type="main" key="Salluvi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Salluvĭi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Saluv-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sal-yes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Celtic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Ligurian tribe in Gallia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 26, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salmacidus: <entryFree id="n42361" type="main" key="salma^ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salmăcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. from salgama, salma, and acidus</etym>, of water, <sense id="n42361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a salt and sour taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salso-acid</hi>: salmacidum <foreign lang="greek">a(lmuro/n,</foreign> salmacidus <foreign lang="greek">a(lmuro/s, a(lw/dhs,</foreign> Gloss. Philox. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquae (with nitrosae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 22, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua (opp. dulcis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 5, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:10:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salmacis: <entryFree id="n42362" type="main" key="Salma^cis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Salmăcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n42362.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A very cleat</hi> <pb n="1620" /> <cb n="SALS" /> <hi rend="ital">fountain in Caria</hi>, much used, and fabled to render soft and effeminate all who drank of it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 286</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:21" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 21</bibl>.—Personified, <hi rend="ital">the nymph of this fountain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 337</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 347</bibl>; <case>voc.</case> Salmaci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:306" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 306</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=329" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 329</bibl> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n42362.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate person</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl> (Trag. v. 36 Vahl.; cf. Trag. Rel. p. 53 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
salmo: <entryFree id="n42363" type="main" key="salmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salmo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a salmon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 18, 32, § 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salmoneus: <entryFree id="n42364" type="main" key="Salmo_neus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Salmōneus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*salmwneu/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Æolus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Sisyphus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who imitated lightning with burning torches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was on that account hurled into Tartarus by a thunderbolt from Jupiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 60" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:61" default="NO">61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:250" default="NO">250</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 585</bibl> Serv.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 514</bibl>; Epigr. ap. Sphaer. Archim. 18.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Salmōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*salmwni/s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">Tyro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of Salmoneus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mother of Neleus and Pelias by Neptune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who assumed the form of Enipeus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 19</bibl> (4, 18), 13; 1, 13, 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 157" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salo: <entryFree id="n42365" type="main" key="salo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sallo</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. 1. salio <sense id="n42365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42366" type="main" key="Sa^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Hispania Tarraconensis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the town of Bilbilis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Xalon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:103:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 103, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:104:6" default="NO">10, 104, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Bilbilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salomon: <entryFree id="n42367" type="main" key="Sa^lo^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălŏmon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlŏmon</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*salwmw/n, *salomw/n, *solomw/n</foreign> [<foreign />], <sense id="n42367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Solomon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of David</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 581</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 717</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 6, 387</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 16</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n42367.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălŏmōnĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sŏlŏm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Solomon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Solomon</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called saxa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 512</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42367.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Să-lŏmōnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">of Solomon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Solomon</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s</hi>: templum, Sid. poët. Ep. 4, 18; Ven. Carm. 1, 11, 1.</sense></entryFree>
salonae: <entryFree id="n42368" type="main" key="Sa^lo_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălōnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 141</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 43), <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maritime town in Dalmatia</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Salona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 8</bibl> and 9.</sense></entryFree>
salor: <entryFree id="n42369" type="main" key="sa^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>salum</etym>, <sense id="n42369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the color of the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-green</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salpa: <entryFree id="n42370" type="main" key="salpa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of stock-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 18, 32, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:121" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salpicta: <entryFree id="n42371" type="greek" key="salpicta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salpicta</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">salpista</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 19</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">salpigkth/s</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">salpisth/s</foreign>), <sense id="n42371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trumpeter</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 21; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 239</bibl> (v. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> p. 440).</sense></entryFree>
salpinates: <entryFree id="n42372" type="main" key="Salpi_na_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Salpīnātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Etruria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 32, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> as <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Salpīnas</orth>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Salpinates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 32, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salpuga: <entryFree id="n42373" type="main" key="salpu_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salpūga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. solipuga.</entryFree>
salsamen: <entryFree id="n42374" type="main" key="salsa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salsāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>salsus</etym>, for salsamentum, <sense id="n42374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">salted food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">any thing pickled in brine</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salsamentarius: <entryFree id="n42375" type="main" key="salsa_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salsāmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>salsamentum</etym>, <sense id="n42375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to salted fish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">NEGOTIANS,</quote> <trans><tr>a dealer in salted fish</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4249</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">salsāmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in salted fish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 54, 67</bibl>; Suet. Vit. Hor. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
salsamentum: <entryFree id="n42376" type="main" key="salsa_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salsāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>salsus</etym>. * <sense id="n42376.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fish-pickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brine</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 57, 117</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42376.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Salted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pickled fish</hi> (usu. in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">salsamenta Fac macerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 9, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 7, 26, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:106 al" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 34, § 106 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:55:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 55, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salse: <entryFree id="n42377" type="main" key="salse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. salio, <sense id="n42377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
salsedo: <entryFree id="n42378" type="main" key="salse_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salsēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>salsus</etym>, <sense id="n42378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a salt taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saltness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salsilago: <entryFree id="n42379" type="main" key="salsi^la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salsĭlāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. salsugo.</entryFree>
salsipotens: <entryFree id="n42380" type="spur" key="Salsi^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Salsĭ-pŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis, a false reading for salipotenti</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 1</bibl>.</entryFree>
salsitas: <entryFree id="n42381" type="main" key="salsi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>salsus</etym>, <sense id="n42381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">saltness</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n42381.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:29" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42381.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sardorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Luc. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salsitudo: <entryFree id="n42382" type="main" key="salsi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salsĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">saltness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brackishness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 54, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salsiusculus: <entryFree id="n42383" type="main" key="salsi^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salsĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n42383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [salsius, from salsus], <hi rend="ital">rather salt</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam salsiuscula comedunt ebriosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salsugo: <entryFree id="n42384" type="main" key="salsu_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salsūgo</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">salsĭlāgo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 42, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:124" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 12, 32, § 124</bibl>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>salsus</etym>, <sense id="n42384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">saltness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brackishness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4</bibl>; <cb n="SALT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:84 al" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 5, 26, § 84 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra salsuginis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a desert</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 39, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 17, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42384.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">salt-water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:92" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 7, 42, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salsula: <entryFree id="n42385" type="main" key="Salsu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Salsŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman female name</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1456, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salsulae: <entryFree id="n42386" type="main" key="Salsu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Salsŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. aquae), <sense id="n42386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a saltspring in Gallia Narbonensis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">La Fontaine des Salses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42386.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city near the salt-spring</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Salses</hi>, ltin. Anton. 389, 7.</sense></entryFree>
salsura: <entryFree id="n42387" type="main" key="salsu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>salsus</etym>. <sense id="n42387.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr. </sense><sense id="n42387.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A salting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pickling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sucidiā et salsurā faciendā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:55:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 55, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42387.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in comic lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita meae animae salsura evenit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I am in such an ill-humor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42387.3" n="II" level="1"> Concr. </sense><sense id="n42387.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Brine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pickle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:48:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 48, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42387.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pickled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">salted fish</hi> (syn. salsamentum): <cit><quote lang="la">pabula salsurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salsus: <entryFree id="n42388" type="main" key="salsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1. salio.</entryFree>
saltabundus: <entryFree id="n42389" type="main" key="salta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>salto</etym>, <sense id="n42389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dancing</hi> (post-class.): saltabundi canebant, quae nunc stantes canunt, Gell 20, 3, 2.</sense></entryFree>
saltatim: <entryFree id="n42390" type="main" key="salta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by leaps</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulis cruribus saltatim currere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saltatio: <entryFree id="n42391" type="main" key="salta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dancing;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">a dance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:18 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 18 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:1" default="NO">2, 18, 1</bibl>; Scipio Afric. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multarum deliciarum comes est extrema saltatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:225" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saltatiuncula: <entryFree id="n42392" type="main" key="salta_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>saltatio</etym>, <sense id="n42392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little dance</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saltator: <entryFree id="n42393" type="main" key="salta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>salto</etym>, <sense id="n42393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dancer</hi> (generally among the Romans with an accessory contemptuous signif.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:89" default="NO">11, 3, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
saltatorie: <entryFree id="n42394" type="main" key="salta_to_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltātōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. saltatorius.</entryFree>
saltatorius: <entryFree id="n42395" type="main" key="salta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>salto</etym>, <sense id="n42395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to dancing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dancing-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saltatory</hi> (class.): ludus, <hi rend="ital">a dancing-school</hi>, Scipio Afric. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10, § 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <trans><tr>a dancing in a ring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">saltātōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like a dancer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a dancing attitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procurrens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saltatricula: <entryFree id="n42396" type="main" key="salta_tri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltātrīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>saltatrix</etym>, <sense id="n42396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little dancing-girl</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
saltatrix: <entryFree id="n42397" type="main" key="salta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saltator</etym>, <sense id="n42397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female dancer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dancing-girl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 9, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saltatus: <entryFree id="n42398" type="main" key="salta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>salto</etym>, <sense id="n42398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (religious) <hi rend="ital">dance</hi> (not ante-Aug., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">(Numa Salios) per urbem ire canentes carmina cum tripudiis sollennique saltatu jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 786" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 786</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltatibus apta juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 637</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saltem: <entryFree id="n42399" type="main" key="saltem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltem</orth> (sometimes in MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">saltim</orth>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 7, 23</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1013</bibl> P.), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>old <case>acc.</case> form, from salvus, salus</etym>. prop., <sense id="n42399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">saved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserved</hi> (salvā re; compare Engl. save, except). It serves to point out that which still remains or holds good, in spite of or by way of exception to something opposed to it; and accordingly is used (like certe, II.) as a restrictive particle, <hi rend="ital">at least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at all events</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anyhow.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42399.1" n="I" level="1"> Affirmatively (class.). </sense><sense id="n42399.2" n="A" level="2"> With a statement of the opposite: <cit><quote lang="la">si illud non licet, Saltem hoc licebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper tu hoc facito cogites, tute uti sis optimus: Si id nequeas, saltem ut optimis sis proximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 86</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:127" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltem accurate, ut metui videar, si resciverim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetrabo, ut aliquot saltem nuptiis prodat dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si alia membra vino madeant, cor sit saltem sobrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi istuc mihi acerbum'st ... saltem id volupe est, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo provocati a me venire noluerunt, revocati saltem revertantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attrepidate saltem, nam vos approperare haud postulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vere nihil potes dicere: finge aliquid saltem commode,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 13, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eripe mihi hunc dolorem aut minue saltem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: neque iis (militibus) posse persuaderi, ut eum defendant aut sequantur saltem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 52</bibl>: <cb n="SALT" /> utinam quietis temporibus atque aliquo, si non bono, at saltem certo statu civitatis haec inter nos studia exercere possemus! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 11, 24</bibl>.—In a question: <cit><quote lang="la">quis ego sum saltem, si non sum Sosia?</quote> <trans><tr>tell me</tr>, <tr>at least</tr>, <tr>who I am; then who am I</tr>, <tr>pray?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 282</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42399.3" n="B" level="2"> Without mention of the opposite: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc sapienter saltem fecit filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltem aliquem velim, qui mihi ex his locis viam monstret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltem Pseudolum mihi dedas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltem aliquid de pondere detraxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:20:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 20, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc saltem ad illos calculos revertamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltem tenet hoc nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut opperiare hos sex dies saltem modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">triduom hoc saltem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltem tantisper, dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antehac quidem sperare saltem licebat: nunc etiam id ereptum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at grammatici saltem omnes descendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>. This last mode of enunciation forms the transition to its use, </sense><sense id="n42399.4" n="II" level="1"> With the negatives <hi rend="ital">non</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neque</hi>, to indicate that not even a single remaining thing specified holds good; and, consequently, = ne ... quidem, <hi rend="ital">not at least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nor even</hi> (so perh. only since the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">ibi tribuni militum non praemunito vallo, non deorum saltem, si non hominum, memores, nec auspicato, etc. ... instruunt aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 43, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 33 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim mihi illud saltem placet, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero saltem iis sufficiat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fratrem, non patruum saltem porta tenus obvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec deformitate istā saltem flumina carebant atque amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ipsum iter neque impervium neque saltem durum putent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mihi statuta saltem cibaria praestabantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 33</bibl></cit>.—Cf. with <hi rend="ital">vix</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vix saltem praecipiendum videtur, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—After <hi rend="ital">ne ... quidem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne a sententiis quidem ac verbis saltem singulis possit separari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salticus: <entryFree id="n42400" type="main" key="salti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saltus</etym>, <sense id="n42400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dancing</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saltim: <entryFree id="n42401" type="main" key="saltim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltim</orth>, v. saltem <sense id="n42401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
saltito: <entryFree id="n42402" type="main" key="salti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n42402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [salto], <hi rend="ital">to dance much</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vigorously</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:142" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 142</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salto: <entryFree id="n42403" type="main" key="salto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salto</orth> (once <orth extent="full" lang="la">salĭto</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=85" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 85</bibl> Müll., Salii a salitando), āvi, ātum, 1, <sense id="n42403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [2. salio], <hi rend="ital">to dance</hi> (in the widest signif. of the word, including pantomime and gesticulation; mostly with a contemptuous accessory signif.). </sense><sense id="n42403.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: vidi in his unum puerum bullatum, non minorem annis duodecim, cum crotalis saltare, quam saltationem impudicus servulus honeste saltare non posset, Scipio Afric. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10</bibl> (v. the whole chapter on this subject); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 24, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro (as an indecorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin scire velim saltare puellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac saltet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 334</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Sa.</hi> Salta, saltabo ego simul. <hi rend="ital">Ste.</hi> Siquidem mihi saltandum est, tum vos date, bibat, tibicini, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 16</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tibicinis modos (ludiones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu inter eas restim ductans saltabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negarem posse eum (sc. oratorem) satisfacere in gestu, nisi palaestram, nisi saltare didicisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:22:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 22, 83</bibl></cit>: si vox est, canta; <cit><quote lang="la">si mollia bracchia, salta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 595</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 14, 6</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">cecinimus vobis, et non saltastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 11, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 32</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantatur ac saltatur per omnes gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 10</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42403.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of an orator, <hi rend="ital">to speak in a jerking manner</hi>, i. e. in little clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">Hegesias dum imitari Lysiam vult, saltat incidens particulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:67:226" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 67, 226</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42403.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dance</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to represent by dancing and gesticulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to perform in pantomime</hi> a play or a part (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pantomimus Mnester tragoediam saltavit, quam olim Neoptolemus tragoedus egerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 57</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pyrrhicham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam mimo saltante puellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyclopa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Glaucum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:83:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 83, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turnum Vergilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 54</bibl></cit>: odaria, <hi rend="ital">to accompany</hi> <pb n="1621" /> <cb n="SALT" /> <hi rend="ital">with dancing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 53, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:54:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 54, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficti saltantur amantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltata poëmata,</quote> <trans><tr>recited with an accompaniment of dancing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:519" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 519</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique jactant cantari saltarique commentarios suos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltatur Venus, saltatur et Magna Mater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, n. 35.</sense></entryFree>
saltuarius: <entryFree id="n42404" type="main" key="saltu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. saltus</etym>, <sense id="n42404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has the care of a forest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of an estate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a forester</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ranger; a steward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bailiff</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:58" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:8:16" default="NO">7, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:15" default="NO">33, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 53, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 6294</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">VIRTVTIS,</quote> <trans><tr>keeper of the grove of Virtue</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1599</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saltuatim: <entryFree id="n42405" type="main" key="saltu^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltŭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>1. saltus</etym>. <sense id="n42405.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">by leaps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">currere singulis cruribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42405.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a written narrative, <hi rend="ital">in a skipping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">desultory manner</hi>: vellicatim ac saltuatim scribere, Sisenn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 15, 2</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 168, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ex loco subinde saltuatim redire festinamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 5, 15 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
saltuensis: <entryFree id="n42406" type="main" key="saltu^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltŭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. saltus</etym>, <sense id="n42406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a forest</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fundi,</quote> <trans><tr>forest-pastures</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 62, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 64, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saltuosus: <entryFree id="n42407" type="main" key="saltu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of woods</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-wooded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">woody</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">convalles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per saltuosos tramites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saltus: <entryFree id="n42408" type="main" key="saltus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. salio</etym>, <sense id="n42408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leaping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bound</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 4</bibl>: saltu uti, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 19</bibl>: cum alacribus saltu, cum velocibus cursu certabat, Sall.
