Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltu pernici tollere corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 559</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(monocoli) mirae pernicitatis ad saltum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora saltu Subiciunt in equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltu Emicat in currum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 326</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 553: saltu superare viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltum dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to make a leap</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 551</bibl></cit>; so in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 165</bibl></cit>; 3, 599; 3, 683; 11, 524; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps saltu sese In fluvium dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 815</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eadem (sc. crura ranarum) sint longis saltibus apta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 377</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42408.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab egestate infimā ad saltum sublati divitiarum ingentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42409" type="main" key="saltus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saltus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n42409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> salti, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 486, 1</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. akin to Sanscr. sar-, sal-, to go; v. Corss. Ausspr. 2, 71</etym>, a woody district, uncultivated but used for pasture, <hi rend="ital">a forest-pasture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">woodland-pasture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">woodland</hi> (level or mountainous); freq. and class.; cf.: silva, nemus, lucus). </sense><sense id="n42409.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: saltus est, ubi silvae et pastiones sunt, quarum causā casae quoque. Si qua particula in eo saltu pastorum aut custodum causā aratur ea res non peremit nomen saltui, non magis quam fundi, qui est in agro culto, et ejus causā habet aedificium, si qua particula in eo habet silvam, Ael. Gall. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:6:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conductor saltūs, in quo fundus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in saltu habente habitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltum pascuum locare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestribus saltibus delectantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltibus in vacuis pascunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">floriferis in saltibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de saltu agroque vi detruditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvis aut saltibus se eripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">montium domina ut fores, Silvarumque virentium Saltuumque reconditorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 34, 11</bibl></cit>; so (with silvae) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 498</bibl>; (with nemora) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in silvestrem saltum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde tot Quinctilianus habet saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:188" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 188</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:194" default="NO">10, 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> E. 2, 2, 178</bibl>.—In the poets also as the abode of wild animals: <cit><quote lang="la">saepire plagis saltum canibusque ciere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1251</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 140</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 471</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus venatibus apti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 498</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42409.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a narrow pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mountain - valley</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia vada ac saltus hujus paludis certis custodiis obtinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrenaeos saltus occupari jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 1, 38; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 19: saltu angusto superatis montibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">angustiae saltibus crebris inclusae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante saltum Thermopylarum in septentrionem versa Epirus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">premendo praesidiis angustos saltus inclusit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum jam claudite saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltibus degressi scrupulosis et inviis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42409.3" n="3" level="3"> In partic., in agriculture,<cb n="SALU" />  <hi rend="ital">a portion of the public lands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of four</hi> centuriae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 10, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42409.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = pudendum muliebre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 56</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n42409.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">meumque erum ex hoc saltu damni salvum ut educam foras,</quote> <trans><tr>from this forest of danger</tr>, <tr>this ticklish situation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 28</bibl></cit>; v. Ritschl ad h. 1.</sense></entryFree>
saluber: <entryFree id="n42410" type="main" key="salu_ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salūber</orth>, v. salubris.</entryFree>
salubris: <entryFree id="n42411" type="main" key="sa^lu_bris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūbris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n42411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălū-ber</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 704</bibl>; but <itype>salubris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 6</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> salubri, v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 30), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>salus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">health-giving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promoting health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">healthful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salubrious; salutary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneficial</hi> (v. salutaris <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n42411.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (freq. and class.) </sense><sense id="n42411.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluber locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl> (opp. pestilens); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl> (opp. pestilens regio); 1, 1, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 290</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl> (opp. gravis); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt partes agrorum aliae pestilentes, aliae salubres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salubrior ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: saluberrimae regiones, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apennino saluberrimo montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Esquiliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irriguis ora salubris aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Baiae salubres repente factae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salubrisne an pestilens annus futurus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saluberrimum (tempus) ver est ... saluberrimi sunt sereni dies ... salubriores septentrionales quam subsolani, etc.... nam fere ventus ubique a mediterraneis regionibus veniens salubris, a mari gravis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflatus ex Apenninis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus atque victus,</quote> <trans><tr>strengthening</tr>, <tr>nourishing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 90</bibl> infra; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suci Ambrosiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluberrimum acetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 48, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluberrimi potus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 2, 19, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medicinā alia salubria alia insalubria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>mindful of the good of others</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebe saluber, ades,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o salute meā salus salubrior!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid est salsum aut salubre in oratione,</quote> <trans><tr>sound</tr>, <tr>solid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 26, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae exemplo haud salubres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(factum) severitate exempli salubre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems saluberrimis consiliis absumpta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia legesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:753" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium,</quote> <trans><tr>advantageous</tr>, <tr>profitable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:104:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 104, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <itype>infra</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n42411.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ad aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contra</hi> (cf. salutaris): <cit><quote lang="la">(sententiam) dixi rei publicae saluberrimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum firmum, corpori salubre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 27</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">et gravi Malvae salubres corpori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:58" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 12</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">salubris parum urbs valetudini suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber salubrior studiis quam dulcior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges rem salubriorem inopi quam potenti (esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluberrima Romano imperio juga Alpium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnes res salubre est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">icterias existimatur salubris contra regios morbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 470</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42411.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in a neutr. sense, of the human body, <hi rend="ital">healthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi> (very rare, and for the most part not till after the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): genus hominum salubri corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salubriora etiam credente corpora esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(exercitum) mutatione locorum salubriorem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut salubri sint corpore pecora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:47:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 47, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes quae saluberrimis corporibus utuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 41</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūbrĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">healthfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholesomely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salubriously; profitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi potest illa aetas aut calescere ... aut vicissim umbris aquisve refrigerari salubrius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:14" default="NO">2, 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut salubrius litigantes consisterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 6, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluberrime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 12, 14, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum trahi salubriter,</quote> <trans><tr>beneficially</tr>, <tr>advantageously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62</bibl></cit>: leges emendatae utiliter, latae salubriter,<cb n="SALU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 89, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:1 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 1 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">emere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at a cheap rate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (laesa) quam saluberrime reficiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 30, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salubritas: <entryFree id="n42412" type="main" key="sa^lu_bri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūbrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>salubris</etym>. <sense id="n42412.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Healthfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholesomeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salubrity</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hostiarum exta, quorum ex habitu atque ex colore tum salubritatis, tum pestilentiae signa percipi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoenitatem hanc (sc. hujus loci) et salubritatem sequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of places,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:4:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 4, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>; Auct. B. G. 8, 52; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 16, 15, § 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 77, § 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 77, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 64</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">salubritatis indicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">de salubritatibus in moenium collocationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42412.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: a vobis (jurisconsultis) salubritas quaedam, ab iis qui dicunt, salus ipsa petitur, <hi rend="ital">healthfulness</hi>, . . . <hi rend="ital">health</hi> (a means of safety ... safety itself), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salubritas et quasi sanitas Atticae dictionis,</quote> <trans><tr>the healthy vigor and soundness</tr>, <tr>as it were</tr>, <tr>of Attic speech</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 13, 51</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 90</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n42412.2" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to salubris, II.) <hi rend="ital">Health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soundness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae ad requiem animi aut salubritatem corporum parentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem illam formam salubritati magis conduxisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensim toto corpore salubritas percipi potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec remedia salubritatem faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socrates dicitur salubritates corporis retinuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicunt morbos salubritatesque circumire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 18, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salubriter: <entryFree id="n42413" type="main" key="sa^lu_bri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūbrĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. salubris <sense id="n42413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
salum: <entryFree id="n42414" type="greek" key="sa^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n42414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form, corresp. to the Gr. <case>acc.</case>, undantem salum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 223, 24</bibl>, or Trag. v. 226 Vahl.), = <foreign lang="greek">sa/los,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the open sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the high sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the main</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the deep;</hi> opp. to the sea near the coast or in a port (occurring only in <number>sing.</number>, and mostly in the <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case>). </sense><sense id="n42414.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:30:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 30, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in salum nave evectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucas (naves) ante portum in salo habiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars (classis) in salo ad ostium portūs in ancoris stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 13</bibl></cit> (cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)n sa/lw( sth=nai,</foreign> to lie at anchor in the open sea); so, <cit><quote lang="la">in salo stare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:12" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul ab insulā in salo navem tenere ancoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42414.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42414.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">rapidum salum tulistis truculentaque pelagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:12" default="NO">1, 15, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO">3, 7</bibl> (4, 6), 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 537</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:55" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 24 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 6.—* </sense><sense id="n42414.4" n="2" level="3"> Like <foreign lang="greek">sa/los,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">sea-sickness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tirones salo nauseāque confecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 28</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42414.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The stream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">current</hi> of a river: <cit><quote lang="la">(amnis) saevit majore salo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:867" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 867</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42414.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The color of the sea</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1</bibl>, §§ 16 and 17.—</sense><sense id="n42414.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sea</hi> of thought, agitation, trouble, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tam aerumnoso navigare salo, Cic. poët. Tusc. 3, 28, 67: cum in isto cogitationis salo fluctuarem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis (with dissensio cogitationum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 225, 30.</sense></entryFree>
salus: <entryFree id="n42415" type="main" key="sa^lu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūs</orth>, <itype>ūtis</itype> (archaic <sense id="n42415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> SALVTES, on a clay vessel, v. Ritschl de Fictilibus Litteratis, Berol, 1853, p. 18, n. 5; cf. APOLONES, from Apollo; <case>dat.</case> SALVTEI, Corp. Inscr. Lat. 587), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root sar, to guard, whence servus, servare, salvus, sollus; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(/los,</foreign> entire</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a being safe and sound; a sound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">whole condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">welfare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preservation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliverance</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.: cf.: valetudo, sanitas). </sense><sense id="n42415.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42415.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: Mars pater te precor, pastores pecuaque salva servassis duisque bonam salutem valetudinemque mihi domo familiaeque nostrae, an old form of prayer in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 27</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, the religious formula for asking protection: quod cum salute ejus fiat,</quote> <trans><tr>and may it do him good</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the same sense: bonā salute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc quae assolent quaeque oportet Signa esse ad salutem, omnia huic (puero recens nato) esse video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrorum salutem ab Aesculapio datam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui etiam medicis suis non ad salutem, sed ad necem utatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me confectum consularibus volneribus consulari medicinā ad salutem reduceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. Quir. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmā potiri salute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1622" /> <cb n="SALU" /> 179: <cit><quote lang="la">salute nostrā atque urbe captā Domum reduco integrum omnem exercitum,</quote> <trans><tr>in good health</tr>, <tr>well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater redit suā salute ac familiae maximā,</quote> <trans><tr>in excellent health</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salute nostrum socium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salute horiae,</quote> <trans><tr>uninjured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in optimorum consiliis posita est civitatium salus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu eris unus, in quo nitatur civitatis salus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 12, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 23, 43: juris, libertatis, fortunarum suarum salus in istius damnatione consistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim salus ulla rei publicae major reperiri potest, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>, § 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem teneo, salutem amisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus aures clausae veritati sunt, hujus salus desperanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quae mihi in te'st, haud tibi est in me salus,</quote> <trans><tr>a means of safety</tr>, <tr>help</tr>, <tr>assistance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fer amanti ero salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum opem indigentibus salutemque ferres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 13, 28</bibl>: dicet fortasse Dignitatis <foreign lang="greek">a(/lis</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluti, si me amas, consule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is est nimirum Soter, qui salutem dedit,</quote> <trans><tr>has furnished safety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:63:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 63, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare salutem, liberare periculis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluti quod tibi esse censeo, id consuadeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">saluti esse alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:49:200 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 49, 200 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: nosse omnia haec, salus est adulescentulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffisus suae omniumque saluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec in fugā salus ulla ostendebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una est salus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una salus victis nullam sperare salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 354</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 174</bibl>; 6, 96; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 648</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 221</bibl>. —Freq. in Plaut. as a term of endearment, <hi rend="ital">my life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">my love</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid agis, mea salus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o salute meā salus salubrior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 153</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 17</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42415.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a wish for one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s welfare</hi> (expressed by word of mouth or in writing), <hi rend="ital">a greeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salutation: Ly.</hi> Charmidem Lysiteles salutat. <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Non ego sum salutis dignus? <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Immo salve Callicles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venienti des salutem atque osculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu primum salutem reddis quam dedi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Responde, quod rogo. <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Eho, an non prius salutas? <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Nulla est mihi salus dataria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 13</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Salva sis. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Salutem accipio mihi et meis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">advenientem peregre herum suum Salva impertit salute servus Epidicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 39</bibl>; for which: impertit salutem plurimam et plenissimam, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 472, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Terentia impertit tibi multam salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem dicere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multam, plurimam salutem dicere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero tibi salutem plurimam dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu Atticae salutem dices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 19, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so at the beginning of a letter: salutem dicit Toxilo Timarchides Et familiae omni. Si valetis gaudeo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">usually abbreviated S. D. (salutem dicit), S. D. M. (salutem dicit multam), S. D. P. (salutem dicit plurimam), v. the superscriptions of Cicero's letters. Freq., also, elliptically, without dicit: Anacharsis Hannoni salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl></cit> (abbreviated, e. g. Cicero Attico S., v. the letters of Cicero and Pliny): <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysio plurimam salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticae plurimam salutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem reddere,</quote> <trans><tr>to return a greeting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 60</bibl>: salutem mittere per aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to send a greeting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi dulcis salus visa est per te missa ab illā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 1</bibl>.—An unusual expression is, salutem dicere alicui, in the sense of <hi rend="ital">to bid one farewell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero multam salutem et foro dicam et curiae, vivamque tecum multum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salute acceptā redditāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salute datā redditāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem tibi ab sodali nuntio,</quote> <trans><tr>I bring</tr>, <tr>deliver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiare salutem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem verbis tuis mihi nuntiarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem tibi plurimam ascribit et Tulliola, deliciae nostrae,</quote> <trans><tr>adds</tr>, <tr>joins in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 20, 9</bibl>.—In a humorous equivoque: <hi rend="ital">As.</hi> <cb n="SALU" /> Salve. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Satis mihi est tuae salutis, nihil moror, sat salveo; <cit><quote lang="la">Aegrotare malim, quam esse tuā salute sanior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:41 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 41 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42415.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Salvation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliverance from sin and its penalties</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">verbum salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 13, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42415.5" n="II" level="1"> Salus, personified, <hi rend="ital">a Roman divinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose temple stood on one of the summits of the</hi> Quirinalis (v. Salutaris): <cit><quote lang="la">ego tibi nunc sum summus Juppiter, Idem ego sum Salus, Fortuna, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 123</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5</bibl>, §§ 51 and 74 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 40, 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">augurium Salutis (instituted for the welfare of the State),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:47:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 47, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 23</bibl>.—In a lusus verbb., alluding to the literal meaning of the name: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Salus nobis saluti jam esse, si cupiat, potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at vos Salus servassit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque jam Salus servare, si volt, me potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 43</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Salus ipsa virorum fortium innocentiam tueri non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:6:11:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 6, 11, § 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salustius: <entryFree id="n42416" type="main" key="Salusti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Salustĭus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Salustĭānus</orth>, v. Sallustius.</entryFree>
salutabundus: <entryFree id="n42417" type="main" key="sa^lu_ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saluto</etym>, <sense id="n42417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saluting</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 729</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salutaris: <entryFree id="n42418" type="main" key="sa^lu_ta_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>salus</etym>, <sense id="n42418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to well-being</hi>, <hi rend="ital">healthful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholesome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salutary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneficial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageous</hi> (in the most general sense, while the predominant meaning of salubris, in class. lang., is healthy in a medical sense; very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n42418.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n42418.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quae mala perniciosaque sunt, habeantur pro bonis ac salutaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro salutaribus mortifera conscribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res salutares (opp. pestiferae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:12:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res utiles et salutares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutaris et vitalis calor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine quo nihil nec laudabile nec salutare est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuta et salutaria capessere (opp. praecipitia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutares litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollonides orationem salutarem habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutaris ars,</quote> <trans><tr>of healing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:63" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amurca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Rarely of persons: civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: bonus et salutaris Princeps, Tiber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42418.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contra aliquid</hi>, etc. (the first very freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">ratio quoniam pestifera sit multis, admodum paucis salutaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum generi universo cultura agrorum est salutaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporibus tot res, animis nulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:27:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox petentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem decoctam bibere, spasticis, etc. ... salutare ost,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 19, 77, § 132</bibl></cit>.—Once also in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est nobis salutarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:9:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella Jovis aut Veneris conjuncta cum Lunā ad ortus puerorum salutaris sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decoctum ad dentium dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 42, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba Britannica non nervis modo salutaris sed contra anginas quoque et contra serpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 3, 6, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicunt radicem et in pestilentiā salutarem esse in cibis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 16, 92, § 148</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42418.4" n="(g)" level="5"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">salvation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliverance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">health</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:49:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 49, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 41, 5</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: bibere salutaria alicui, <hi rend="ital">to drink one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s health</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 128, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42418.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n42418.6" n="A" level="2"> As an appellative: salutaris littera, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the letter A</hi>, written on the voting tablets as an abbreviation for absolvo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 6, 15</bibl> (opp. littera tristis, i. e. C, for condemno): digitus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the index-finger</hi> (perh. as used in greeting), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42418.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, i. q. salus, <hi rend="ital">welfare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:115:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 115, 13</bibl> (4) (for the Heb. <foreign />).—<hi rend="ital">Adj. prop.</hi>: Collis Salutaris, <hi rend="ital">one of the four summits of the Quirinal</hi> (so called from the temple of Salus, which stood on it), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 52</bibl> Müll.; cf. Salus, II.; <cit><quote lang="la">and v. Becker, Antiq. 1, pp. 568 and 578 sq.: Salutaris porta appellata est ab aede Salutis, quae ei proxima fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=326" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 326</bibl></cit> Müll.: Jovem cum Optimum et Maximum dicimus, cumque eundem Salutarem Hospitalem. Statorem:<cb n="SALU" />  hoc intellegi volumus, salutem hominum in ejus esse tutelā (corresp. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*zeu\s *swth/r</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Jesus) Latine dicitur salutaris sive salvator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtārĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">profitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneficially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salutarily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: se recipere, Plancus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitare aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque consulatus salutariter rei publicae administrati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec salutariter scripsi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 8, 17</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> of the <pos>adv.</pos>, and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> of the <pos>adj.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
salutatio: <entryFree id="n42419" type="main" key="sa^lu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saluto</etym>, <sense id="n42419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a greeting. saluting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salutation</hi> (rare but good prose). </sense><sense id="n42419.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis te aditu, quis ullo honore, quis denique communi salutatione dignum putet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutationem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutationem reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutatione acceptā ac redditā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuā salutatione factā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—Of performing devotions: <cit><quote lang="la">uti praetereuntes possint respicere (aedificia deorum) et in conspectu salutationes facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—Rarely of a written greeting (in a lusus verbb. with salus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 16, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Col. 9, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42419.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of ceremonial visits, <hi rend="ital">a visit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a waiting upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane salutamus domi et bonos viros multos, etc. ... Ubi salutatio defluxit, litteris me involvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 14:6 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 14, 6 al.</bibl>—After the time of the emperors, of <hi rend="ital">paying respects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paying court</hi> to the emperor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 4 al.</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salutator: <entryFree id="n42420" type="main" key="sa^lu_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who greets; a greeter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saluter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42420.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">salutator regum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:4:29" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42420.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (cf. salutatio, II.), <hi rend="ital">one who makes complimentary visits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who pays his respects to</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">a visitor;</hi> also (in the time of the emperors), <hi rend="ital">one who appears at court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a courtier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 9:34" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 9, 34</bibl>; Col. praef. § 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:71:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 71, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:74:2" default="NO">10, 74, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salutatorius: <entryFree id="n42421" type="main" key="sa^lu_ta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> (postAug.). <sense id="n42421.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to visiting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">paying court</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia,</quote> <trans><tr>an audience-chamber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 11, 10, § 38</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">să-lūtātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the audience-chamber</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42421.1" n="II" level="1"> In gram.. salutatorius casus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the vocative</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 671</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
salutatrix: <entryFree id="n42422" type="main" key="sa^lu_ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>salutator</etym> (postAug.), <sense id="n42422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that salutes;</hi> occurring only in apposition. </sense><sense id="n42422.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:87:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 87, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">charta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a letter of greeting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:99:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 99, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42422.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">she that makes complimentary visits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that pays court</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the crowd of clients who come to salute their patron in the morning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:21" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salutifer: <entryFree id="n42423" type="main" key="sa^lu_ti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>salus-fero</etym> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for salubris), <sense id="n42423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">health-bringing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">healing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salubrious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totique salutifer orbi Cresce, puer, dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 642</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">anguis Urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:744" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 744</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 632: herbae animantibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:1:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutiferā potione pestem veneni exstinguere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 251, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 118" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 26, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 4, 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salutificator: <entryFree id="n42424" type="main" key="sa^lu_ti^fi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtĭfĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>salus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n42424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringer of safety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a savior</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carn. Chr. 14</bibl> (al. salvificator).</sense></entryFree>
salutiger: <entryFree id="n42425" type="main" key="sa^lu_ti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>salusgero</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n42425.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Health-bringing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 8, 26</bibl></cit> (cf. salutaris, II. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): ortus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 11, 235.—</sense><sense id="n42425.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That brings a greeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salutatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 25, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who delivers a greeting; a messenger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 45, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salutigerulus: <entryFree id="n42426" type="hapax" key="sa^lu_ti^ge^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūtĭgĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that carries salutations</hi> or <hi rend="ital">messages</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <trans><tr>errand-boys</tr>, <tr>pages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salutio: <entryFree id="n42427" type="main" key="Sa^lu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sălūtĭo</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Salvitto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname of one Scipio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 2, 2, § 8</bibl>; v. Sillig ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
saluto: <entryFree id="n42428" type="main" key="sa^lu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sălūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n42428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> salutantum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 318</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 462</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 295</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>salus</etym>. * </sense><sense id="n42428.1" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to salus, I. A.) <hi rend="ital">To keep safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to preserve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequenti anno palmites salutentur pro viribus matris singuli aut gemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 177</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42428.2" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to salus, I. B.) <hi rend="ital">To greet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wish</hi> <pb n="1623" /> <cb n="SALV" /> <hi rend="ital">health to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s respects to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salute</hi> any one (freq. in all periods and kinds of composition; cf.: salvere jubeo). </sense><sense id="n42428.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Charmidem Lysiteles salutat,</quote> <trans><tr>greets</tr>, <tr>bids good-day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Di te ament, Agorastocles. <hi rend="ital">Ag.</hi> Magis me benigne nunc salutas, quam antidhac, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem te heri advenientem ilico et salutavi et, valuissesne usque, exquisivi simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:83 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 83 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille eum salutasset, ut fit, dixissetque: Quid agis, Grani? respondit: Immo vero, tu Druse, quid agis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem paulo liberius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 16, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutabunt benigne, comiter appellabunt unum quemque nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo me salutat blandius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos postquam salutavi, Quid vos, inquam, Brute et Attice, nunc?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem quidem sui Caesarem salutabant,</quote> <trans><tr>greeted as Cœsar</tr>, <tr>saluted by the name of Cœsar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. passively: Pompeius eo proelio Imperator est appellatus. Hoc nomen obtinuit, atque ita se postea salutari passuś est, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 71</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem imperatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 80</bibl>: aliquem dominum regemque. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:161" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nero Britannicum nomine, illi Domitium salutavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 58</bibl>: bene vale Tironemque meum saluta nostris verbis, <hi rend="ital">greet in my name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for me</hi>, Curius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 29, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius te omnesque vos salutat,</quote> <trans><tr>salutes</tr>, <tr>sends greeting to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse salutatum vult te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 28</bibl>.—Of paying reverence to a divinity: <cit><quote lang="la">deos atque amicos iit salutatum ad forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 81</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56 al.</bibl>—Of wishing one well when sneezing: <cit><quote lang="la">cur sternumentis salutamus?</quote> <trans><tr>why do we say</tr>, <tr>God bless you?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 23</bibl></cit>.—Of greeting a place: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam laeto socii clamore salutant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 25</bibl></cit>;
