cf. <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:687" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 687</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 15</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42428.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bid farewell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take leave</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">etiamnunc saluto te, priusquam eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notam puppem de rupe salutant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:31" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42428.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n42428.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To visit out of compliment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pay one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s respects to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wait upon</hi> a person: <cit><quote lang="la">Curtius venit salutandi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad me salutandi causā venisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eram continuo Piliam salutaturus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutatum introire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 28, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 101</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:184" default="NO">3, 184</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42428.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To greet</hi> one's visitors (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mane salutamus domi et bonos viros multos, etc. ... Veniunt etiam, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42428.8" n="3" level="3"> Under the emperors, of the morning attendance at court, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 92</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
saluvii: <entryFree id="n42429" type="main" key="Saluvi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saluvĭi</orth>, v. Salluvii.</entryFree>
salvamentum: <entryFree id="n42430" type="main" key="salva_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salvāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>salvo</etym>, <sense id="n42430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">salvation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Ven. v. Alb. 9.</sense></entryFree>
salvatio: <entryFree id="n42431" type="main" key="salva_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deliverance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salvation</hi> (late Lat.), Boëth. Duab. Nat. p. 953; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joel, 2, 32</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 27, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salvator: <entryFree id="n42432" type="main" key="salva_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salvātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n42432.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a saviour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserver</hi> (late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">class. servator): Cicero Soterem salvatorem noluit nominare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 510</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 17, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">IOVI SALVATORI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42432.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in the Vulg. and Christian fathers, as a transl. of <foreign lang="greek">swth/r</foreign> and Jesus (Heb. <foreign />), <hi rend="ital">the Saviour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Redeemer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christus Jesus, id est Christus Salvator: hoc est enim Latine Jesus ... Salus Latinum nomen est: salvare et salvator non fuerunt haec Latina, antequam veniret Salvator, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 299:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 299, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 13:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 13, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 12, 6</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 1, 115; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 2, 155</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
salve: <entryFree id="n42433" type="main" key="salve_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. salvus <sense id="n42433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n42434" type="main" key="salve_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salvē</orth>, <sense id="n42434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imp.</hi>, v. salveo.</sense></entryFree>
salveo: <entryFree id="n42435" type="main" key="salve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>salvus</etym>. <sense id="n42435.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be well</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">in good health;</hi> so in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> only once in a lusus verbb. with the foll.; v. II. 1. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n42435.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., as a term of salutation. </sense><sense id="n42435.2" n="1" level="3"> Salve, salveto, salvete, <hi rend="ital">God save you; how are you? I hope you are well;</hi> and, salvere jubeo, <hi rend="ital">I bid you good-day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goodday</hi>, <hi rend="ital">welcome</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.; cf.: <cb n="SALV" /> haveo, valeo): <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Charmidem Lysiteles salutat. <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Non ego sum salutis dignus? <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Immo salve, Callicles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 29</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Curculio exoptate, salve. <hi rend="ital">Cu.</hi> Salve. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Salvum gaudeo te advenire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 27</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Cr.</hi> O Mysis, salve. <hi rend="ital">My.</hi> Salvus sis, Crito, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 7</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Ergasile, salve. <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Di te bene ament, Hegio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 35</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Salve, adulescens. <hi rend="ital">Sc.</hi> Et tu multum salveto, adulescentula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 3</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Pl.</hi> Pater, salveto, amboque adeo. <hi rend="ital">Dac.</hi> Salvos sies, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 15</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Gymnasium flagri, salveto. <hi rend="ital">Li.</hi> Quid agis, custos carceris? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessi ad adulescentes in foro: Salvete, inquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvete, Athenae, te video libens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvete, fures maritimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo advorsum ... Jubeo te salvere voce summā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvere jussi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusseram salvere te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: Dionysium jube salvere, <hi rend="ital">greet</hi> (for me), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 14, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexin salvere jubeas velim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvere jubet prior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem parentemque urbis Romanae salvere omnes jubent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, also, once, salvebis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">you are saluted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvebis a meo Cicerone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—Of a salutation, i. e. adoration of a divinity: <cit><quote lang="la">salve, vera Jovis proles (sc. Hercules),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 301</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in a solemn address to any revered object: <cit><quote lang="la">salve, magna parens frugum, Saturnia tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 32, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o salve Lapithaeae gloria gentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salve, laeta dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 87</bibl></cit>.—Also on one's sneezing, <hi rend="ital">God bless you!</hi> Giton ter continuo sternutavit ... Eumolpus salvere Gitona jubet, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 98, 4</bibl>. —In a lusus verbb. alluding to the prim. signif.: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Salve. <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Egon' salva sim, quae siti sicca sum? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 26</bibl>; cf. infra, 2.—With a similar allusion, in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.: As.</hi> Salve. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Sat mihi'st tuae salutis, nihil moror, sat salveo; <cit><quote lang="la">Aegrotare malim, quam esse tuā salute sanior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n42435.3" n="2" level="3"> Sometimes with vale, in taking leave, <hi rend="ital">farewell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goodby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adieu</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vale atque salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vale, salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salveto tu, tu vale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in reply to salvus sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>.— Hence, also, in bidding farewell to the dead: ideo mortuis Salve et Vale dici, non quod aut valere aut salvi esse possunt, sed quod ab his recedimus, eos numquam visuri, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salve aeternum mihi, maxime Palla, Aeternumque vale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 97</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, in imitation: salve supremum, senior mitissime patrum, Supremumque vale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:208" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 208</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4747</bibl>.—In allusion to the literal signif. (v. supra): <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Salve. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Salvere me jubes, quoi tu abiens affers morbum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salvia: <entryFree id="n42436" type="main" key="salvi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb sage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 71, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 6, 17, § 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salvianus: <entryFree id="n42437" type="main" key="Salvi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Salvĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n42437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">named from one Salvius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Salvian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:33:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 33, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salvificator: <entryFree id="n42438" type="main" key="salvi^fi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salvĭfĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, v. salutificator.</entryFree>
salvifico: <entryFree id="n42439" type="main" key="salvi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salvĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>salvus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n42439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to save</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pater istā memet ab horā Salvifica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salvificus: <entryFree id="n42440" type="main" key="salvi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salvĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">saving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. ad Sor. 180</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
salvo: <entryFree id="n42441" type="main" key="salvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>salvus</etym>, <sense id="n42441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to save</hi> (late Lat.; opp. perdere; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: servo, conservo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; Lact. de Ira Dei, 5, 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 4, 2</bibl>; id. Amos, 2, 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
salvus: <entryFree id="n42442" type="main" key="salvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">salvus</orth> (ante-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">-vos</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root sar, sal; v. salus</etym>, <sense id="n42442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">saved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unharmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n42442.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very freq. and class.; syn.: sospes, sanus, incolumis): Mars pater, te precor, pastores pecuaque salva servassis duisque bonam salutem valetudinemque mihi, etc., an ancient form of praver in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 3</bibl>; cf.: si respublica populi Romani Quiritium ad quinquennium proximum salva servata erit hisce duellis, datum donum duit, etc., an ancient formula in making votive offerings. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 11</bibl>; cf. also: di me servant, salva res est; <cit><quote lang="la">salvum est, si quid non perit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 82</bibl>: ita me gessi, Quirites, ut omnes salvi conservaremini, Cic. <cb n="SALV" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos suā stultitiā occidisse, cum tuā prudentiā salvi esse potuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:Fam. 4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvum atque incolumem exercitum transducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civibus salvis atque incolumibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:22:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 22, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum ut salvae et incolumes, verum etiam ut amplae atque potentes sint civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:56:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 56, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium tuom modo in portu vivum, salvom et sospitem vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: salvam et sospitem rempublicam, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re salvā (opp. in re perditā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">salva res (opp. perdita),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 23</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Obsecro, num navis periit? <hi rend="ital">Ac.</hi> Salva est navis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi aliquo accepto detrimento, tamen summa exercitus salva, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sana et salva sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 88</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with sanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 65</bibl> (al. sarta); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica sana ac salva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:23:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 23, 3 al.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, in inscrr., without a connecting particle: SANVS SALVVS, or SALVVS SANVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4360</bibl></cit> and 2143: <cit><quote lang="la">bene factum te advenisse, Pamphile, Atque adeo salvom atque validum ... Nam illum vivum et salvom vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bene re gestā salvos convortor domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">salvom redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 58 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">advenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum illum debilem factum ... in curiam esse delatum, cumque senatui somnium enarravisset, pedibus suis salvom revertisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 26, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam salvis suis exuitur servitus muliebris,</quote> <trans><tr>while their friends are living</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec est mendacio locus salvis, qui interfuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non uxor salvum te vult, non filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis te salvo est opus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Salvom signum est? <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Inspice. <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Recte, ita est ut obsignavi, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula (opp. conscissa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 25, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penelope,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>chaste</tr>, <tr>inviolate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid salvi est mulieri amissā pudicitiā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam salvis rebus colloqui potuissemus,</quote> <trans><tr>while matters were still undisturbed</tr>, <tr>before all was lost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem ager nobis salvus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 192</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 21</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae viginti sanae ac salvae sunt tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42442.2" n="B" level="2"> Freq. with a noun in the <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without violation of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvā lege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 10, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc videmur esse consecuti, ut ne quid agi cum populo aut salvis auspiciis aut salvis legibus aut denique sine vi possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvis auspiciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvo officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvo jure nostrae veteris amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:77:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 77, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio tibi aliquā ex parte, quod salvā fide possim, parcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae salvā fide facere possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietate salvā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvo pudore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvā virginitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuā re salvā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 95</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">salvā causae ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvā conscientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvā tractatione causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvo poëtae sensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salva innocentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salva gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvo ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:181" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut salvo jam et composito die possis ibi manere,</quote> <trans><tr>an unbroken day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: salvo eo, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">with this reservation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proviso</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:1:section=40" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 1, § 40</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n42442.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n42442.4" n="A" level="2"> Salvus sum, <hi rend="ital">I am safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all is well with me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I am freed from my difficulties</hi>, etc.; and, salva res est, <hi rend="ital">the affair is all right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all is well</hi> (belonging only to colloquial lang.). </sense><sense id="n42442.5" n="1" level="3"> Salvos sum, salva spes est, ut verba audio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvos sum, siquidem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">salvos sum, si haec vera sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvos sum, jam philosophatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 24</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Salva sum. <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> At ego perii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 15</bibl>: si istam firmitudinem animi obtines; <cit><quote lang="la">salvi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: tace, obsecro; <cit><quote lang="la">salvae sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pl.</hi> Me perisse praedicas. <hi rend="ital">Dae.</hi> Meā quidem hercle causā salvos sis licet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 51</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 21</bibl>: ne sim salvus, si aliter scribo ac sentio, <hi rend="ital">may I die</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl>, a.—</sense><sense id="n42442.6" n="2" level="3"> Di me servant, salva <pb n="1624" /> <cb n="SAMB" /> res est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salva res est! bene promittit! spero servabit fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salva res est, philosophatur quoque jam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erubuit: salva res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: salva res est; <cit><quote lang="la">nimirum hic homines frigent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">euge, salva res est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 98</bibl></cit>: surrexit; horsum se capessit; <cit><quote lang="la">salva res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42442.7" n="3" level="3"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">saved from sin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saved by Christ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 2, 21</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp.: salvum facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to save</tr>, <tr>deliver</tr>, <tr>bring to salvation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 16, 30</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n42442.8" n="B" level="2"> Salvus sis, a term of greeting or welcome, for salve, <hi rend="ital">how do you do? good-day to you! heaven bless you!</hi> also, at parting, <hi rend="ital">farewell: Ge.</hi> Ibo atque hunc compellabo. Salvos sis. <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> Et tu salve, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 44</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 7</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Pl.</hi> Pater, salveto. <hi rend="ital">Dae.</hi> Salvos sies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 15</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> Salva sis. Phronesium. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Salve, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 6</bibl>.—In a double sense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 30</bibl>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">salvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in good health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in good condition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">circumstances</hi> (only in colloquial lang.): <hi rend="ital">Mu.</hi> Salve multum, mi pater. <hi rend="ital">Se.</hi> Salva sis: <cit><quote lang="la">salven' advenio? salven' arcessi jubes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thallus ubi sit et quam salve agat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 302, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 1, p. 114, 13</bibl>.—So the ellipt. expression, satin' salve? (sc. agis? agitur? res se habent? etc.) <hi rend="ital">is all well? all right? Le.</hi> Satin' salve? dic mihi. <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Recte, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 8</bibl> Don.: <cit><quote lang="la">percontantibus utrimque, Satin' salve, Sall. Fragm. Don. ad Ter. l. l.: cum pater Satin' salve? et quaenam ea moestitia esset? interrogaret eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 2</bibl></cit> (v. l. satin' salvae?); 3, 26, 9; 6, 34, 8; 10, 18, 11. —Once <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: salvene? <hi rend="ital">is all well?</hi> salvene, amabo? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 10</bibl>.—In a double sense: <cit><quote lang="la">(Lucretia) quaerenti viro, Satin' salve? Minime, inquit, quid enim salvi est mulieri amissā pudicitiā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> do not occur in the <pos>adj.</pos> or <pos>adv.</pos></sense></entryFree>
sam: <entryFree id="n42443" type="main" key="sam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sam</orth> = suam, v. suus <sense id="n42443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
samaei: <entryFree id="n42444" type="main" key="Sa^maei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Same, II. <sense id="n42444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
samara: <entryFree id="n42445" type="main" key="samara"><orth extent="full" lang="la">samara</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. samera <sense id="n42445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
samarabriae: <entryFree id="n42446" type="main" key="Samarabri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Samarabrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
samardacus: <entryFree id="n42447" type="foreign" key="sa^marda^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sămardăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>African</etym>, <sense id="n42447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a juggler</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. cont. Acad. 3, 15; cf. Schol. Cruq. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 113</bibl> (al. sarmadacus).</sense></entryFree>
samaria: <entryFree id="n42448" type="main" key="Sa^ma^ri_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămărīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sama/reia</foreign> (orig. Heb. <foreign />), <sense id="n42448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the middle district of Palestine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 13, 14, § 68</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42448.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Să-mărītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Samaria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Samaritans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:17:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 17, 29</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămărī-tes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Samaritan</hi>, Hadr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Sat. 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42448.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămărītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Samaritan woman</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 246</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">252</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 3, 405</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42448.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămărītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Samaritan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 222</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the Samaritans</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Esd. 4, 2.— </sense><sense id="n42448.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămărītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Samaritan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 256</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42448.5" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămă-rēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Samaritan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
samarobriva: <entryFree id="n42449" type="main" key="Sa^ma^ro^bri_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămărŏbrīva</orth> (SAMARABRIVA, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5236</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">in the country of the</hi> Ambiani, now <hi rend="ital">Amiens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 16, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sambraceni: <entryFree id="n42450" type="main" key="Sambrace_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sambracēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sambrachate: <entryFree id="n42451" type="main" key="Sambrachate_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sambrachatē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island on the Arabian coast;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">a city upon it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sambuca: <entryFree id="n42452" type="greek" key="sambu_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sambūca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sambu/kh.</foreign> <sense id="n42452.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A triangular stringed-instrument of a very sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrill tone</hi> (and hence of slight esteem), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 57</bibl>; Scipio Afric. ap. Mácr. S. 2, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:95" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 26</bibl>; cf. Fest. pp. 324 and 325 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 3, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42452.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a machine of like form used by besiegers; a sort of bridge for storming walls</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 1</bibl>. c.</sense></entryFree>
sambuceus: <entryFree id="n42453" type="main" key="sambu_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sambūcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sambucus</etym>, <sense id="n42453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of elder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elder-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 14, § 57</bibl></cit> (Jahn, sabuceus): <cit><quote lang="la">baculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 10" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sambucina: <entryFree id="n42454" type="hapax" key="sambu_ci^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sambūcĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sambuca-cano</etym>, <sense id="n42454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female player on the</hi> sambuca (with fidicina,<cb n="SAMO" />  tibicina), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 57</bibl>; cf. sambucistria.</sense></entryFree>
sambucistria: <entryFree id="n42455" type="greek" key="sambu_cistri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sambūcistrĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sambȳc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sambuki/stria</foreign>, <sense id="n42455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman that plays on the</hi> sambuca (with psaltria), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2</bibl>, n. 42; cf. Fest. pp. 324 and 325 Müll., and v. sambucina.</sense></entryFree>
sambucus: <entryFree id="n42456" type="main" key="sambu_cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sambūcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sambuca</etym>, <sense id="n42456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who plays on the</hi> sambuca, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 924</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42457" type="main" key="sambu_cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sambūcus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">săbūcus</orth>, ap. Ser. Samm.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an elder-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 18, 30, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:151 al" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 20, 34, § 151 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 7, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 337</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27, 503 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sambū-cum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the fruit of the elder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elder-berries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 160" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
same: <entryFree id="n42458" type="main" key="Sa^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămŏs</orth>, acc. to the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">*sa/mos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 711</bibl> Jahn and Bach <sense id="n42458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Odyss. 4</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sa/mh.</foreign> </sense><sense id="n42458.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An earlier name for the island of Cephalenia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Ionian Sea</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Cephalonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 271</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:67" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:303" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 303</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 42</bibl> (acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 54</bibl>, another neighboring island).—</sense><sense id="n42458.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The principal town of the island of Cephalenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Same</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 28</bibl> and 29.</sense></entryFree>
samera: <entryFree id="n42459" type="main" key="samera"><orth extent="full" lang="la">samera</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">samara</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 17, 29, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:76" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 11, 15, § 76</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the seed of the elm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:6" default="NO">5, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:7" default="NO">7, 6, 7</bibl>; 9, 13, 2.</sense></entryFree>
samia: <entryFree id="n42460" type="main" key="Sa^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Samus, I.</entryFree>
samiator: <entryFree id="n42461" type="main" key="sa^mi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sămĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>samio</etym>, <sense id="n42461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a polisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furbisher</hi> (late Lat.), Edict. Diocl. p. 20; Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
samio: <entryFree id="n42462" type="main" key="sa^mi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sămĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Samius</etym>, <sense id="n42462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to polish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">furbish with Samian stone</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">loricas, cataphractas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: ferramenta, Aur. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
samiolus: <entryFree id="n42463" type="main" key="Sa^mi^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n42463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">Samian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poterium,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>of Samian cīay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
samius: <entryFree id="n42464" type="main" key="Sa^mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Samus, I.</entryFree>
sammonium: <entryFree id="n42465" type="main" key="Sammoni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sammonĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Samon-</orth>) <itype>promontorium</itype>, <sense id="n42465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory of Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
samnis: <entryFree id="n42466" type="main" key="Samni_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Samnīs, Samnītĭcus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Samnītes</orth>, v. Samnium.</entryFree>
samnium: <entryFree id="n42467" type="main" key="Samni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Samnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from Sabinium, from Sabini: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Sabinis orti Samnites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 29</bibl></cit> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n42467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient country of Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose inhabitants were an offshoot from the Sabines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:69:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 69, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:7 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 7 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42467.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Samnīs</orth> (collat. form of the <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Samnītis</orth>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 762</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 515</bibl>), <itype>ītis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Samnium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Samnite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 12, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:560" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 560</bibl></cit>: habitator Samnitis (terrae), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 11, 207.— <pos>Subst.</pos>, in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Samnītes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype> (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Samnitum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf. Samnitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> and so usu. and very freq. in Liv., Plin., and Tac.), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Samnium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Samnites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:3:86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 3, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 29</bibl> sq.; 8, 1 sq.; 9, 1 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 30, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:55 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 16, 55 al.</bibl>—Gr. <case>acc.</case> Samnităs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 34:section=6" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 34, § 6</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Samnīs</orth>, <itype>ītis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, collect., <hi rend="ital">the Samnites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 137</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42467.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, the name of Samnites was also given to <hi rend="ital">a class of gladiators who were armed with Samnite weapons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=142" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 142</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 325</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 23, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2569</bibl>.—So in <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Samnīs</orth>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl>; and ap. de Or. 3, 23, 86.—</sense><sense id="n42467.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Samnītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Samnite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pertin. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
samolus: <entryFree id="n42468" type="foreign" key="samo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">samŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n42468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, supposed to be <hi rend="ital">the Anemone pulsatilla</hi> (Linn.), but, acc. to Sprengel, the Samolus valerandi, Linn.; or <hi rend="ital">brook-weed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 63, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
samos: <entryFree id="n42469" type="main" key="Sa^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Samus.</entryFree>
samosata: <entryFree id="n42470" type="main" key="Samo^sa^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Samŏsăta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ *samo/sata</foreign>, <sense id="n42470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of Commagene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the western shore of the Euphrates</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Samosat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 104, 108, § 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 24, 20, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 24, 21, § 86</bibl>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Samŏsăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 4, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămŏsătēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Samosata</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Samosatene</hi>: Paulus, Ambros. de Fide, 5, 8, § 105; Incarn. Dom. Sac. 2, § 8. <cb n="SANA" /></sense></entryFree>
samothracia: <entryFree id="n42471" type="main" key="Sa^mo^thra_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămŏthrācĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Samothrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an island near the coast of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for the mystic worship of the Cabiri</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Samothraki</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 37, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=58" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 58</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 208</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămŏthrācē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 73</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămŏthrāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:46" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 46</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thrēïcĭa Să-mus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămos</orth>, after the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qrhi+ki/h *sa/mos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 20</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n42471.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămŏthrācĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Samothracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrea (a kind of rings first made there),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1044" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1044</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 23</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">caepa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 101</bibl></cit>: insula, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Samothrace</hi>, and, named from it, gemma, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 181</bibl> (Jahn, Samothraca). —</sense><sense id="n42471.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămŏthrāces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Samothrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Samothracians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=58" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 157</bibl>.—Also a dject.: <cit><quote lang="la">Samothraces di,</quote> <trans><tr>the Cabiri</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 1</bibl></cit>. 1.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 4</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jures licet et Samothracum Et nostrorum aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:144" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 144</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42471.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămŏthrācēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Samothracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zocles,</quote> <trans><tr>of Samothrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 63, § 167</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42471.4" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămŏthrācĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Samothracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">religiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42471.5" n="5" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămŏthrācus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Samothracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:439" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 439</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sampsa: <entryFree id="n42472" type="main" key="sampsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sampsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pulp of olives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 49</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> 12, 51, 2; 12, 52, 10.</sense></entryFree>
sampsiceramus: <entryFree id="n42473" type="main" key="Sampsi^ce^ra^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sampsĭcĕrămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a humorous designation of Pompey in Cicero</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s letters</hi> (after a petty king of Emesa conquered by him), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sampsuchinus: <entryFree id="n42474" type="greek" key="sampsu_chi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sampsūchĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">samyu/xiuos</foreign>, <sense id="n42474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of marjoram</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 22, 93, § 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sampsuchum: <entryFree id="n42475" type="greek" key="sampsu_chum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sampsūchum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-sūchus</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 11</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sampsūcum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:171" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 171</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/myuxon</foreign>, <sense id="n42475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marjoram</hi>: Origanum majorana, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 35, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:163" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 22, 93, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:171" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
samus: <entryFree id="n42476" type="main" key="Sa^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sa/mos.</foreign> <sense id="n42476.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island on the coast of Asia Minor opposite Ephesus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famed as the birthplace of Pythagoras</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as also for its earth and the vessels made from it</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Samo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 221</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Samum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 15, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Threïciam Samon (i. e. Samothraciam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 208</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Samos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Samian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>the district belonging to it on the neighboring main-land</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno,</quote> <trans><tr>worshipped there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:19:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 19, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pythagoras</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 60</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 62</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Pythagoras</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis, used for polishing gold,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 21, 40, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>Samian earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 16, 53, § 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:194 al" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 12, 53, § 194 al.</bibl>: testa, <hi rend="ital">earthen-ware made of Samian</hi> (<hi rend="ital">or other equally fine</hi>) <hi rend="ital">clay</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 398, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:47" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 41</bibl>: catinus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 398, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capedines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42476.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. placenta), <hi rend="ital">a kind of cake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42476.2" n="2" level="3"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Samian ware</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 51, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 45, 9</bibl>.—Its brittleness was proverbial; hence, in a comical lusus verbb.: <hi rend="ital">Pi.</hi> (Inveni Bacchidem) Samiam. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Vide quaeso, ne quis tractet illam indiligens: <cit><quote lang="la">Scis tu, ut confringi vas cito Samium solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 65</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dim. adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămĭŏ-lus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Samian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poterium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42476.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Samos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Samians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42476.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The island of Cephalenia</hi>, v. Same.</sense></entryFree>
sanabilis: <entryFree id="n42477" type="main" key="sa_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sānābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sano</etym>, <sense id="n42477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be healed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remediable</hi> (rare but class.); <cit><quote lang="la">of the body: vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor sanabilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; of the mind, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 3</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
sanates: <entryFree id="n42478" type="gloss" key="Sanates"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sanates</orth> <itype>dicti sunt</itype>, qui supra infraque Romam habitaverunt: quod nomen ideo his est inditum, quia cum defecissent a Romanis, brevi post in amicitiam quasi <pb n="1625" /> <cb n="SANC" /> sanatā mente redierunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=326" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 326</bibl> Müll. —The word occurred in the laws of the Twelve Tables, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 8</bibl>, and Fest. l. l.</entryFree>
sanatio: <entryFree id="n42479" type="main" key="sa_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sānātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sano</etym>, <sense id="n42479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a healing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curing</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">certa et propria (perturbationis animi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 28, 60</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, Tert. Fug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sanator: <entryFree id="n42480" type="main" key="sa_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sānātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a healer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 294</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27, 272</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sanatorius: <entryFree id="n42481" type="main" key="sa_na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sānātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">giving health</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Trip. 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sancaptis: <entryFree id="n42482" type="main" key="sancaptis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sancaptis</orth>, v. saucaptis.</entryFree>
sanchromaton: <entryFree id="n42483" type="main" key="sanchro_ma^ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanchrōmăton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n42483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called</hi> dracontea, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sancio: <entryFree id="n42484" type="main" key="sanci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sancĭo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n42484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> sancierat, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 368</bibl> P.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 904</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">sancivi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 904</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 368</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> sancitum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 587</bibl>; Cass. Sev. ap. Diom. l. l.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root sac, sak, to accompany, honor (cf. sequor); whence also sacer; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*(a*g, a(/gios, a(gno/s</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to render sacred</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inviolable</hi> by a religious act; <hi rend="ital">to appoint as sacred</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inviolable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42484.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, mostly of legal ordinances or other public proceedings, <hi rend="ital">to fix unalterably; to establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordain;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">to make irrevocable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unalterable; to enact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confirm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ratify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanction</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: caveo, scisco). </sense><sense id="n42484.2" n="A" level="2"> Sancire legem (jus, foedus, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">legibus istis, quas senatus de ambitu sancire voluerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 18, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cretum leges, quas sive Juppiter sive Minos sanxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasdam leges ex integro sanxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">sancire legem, Ne quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas Quas bis quinque viri sanxerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam temere in nosmet legem sancimus iniquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem sanciendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec igitur lex sanciatur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 40</bibl></cit>, and 13, 44; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">M.
