Valerius consul de provocatione legem tulit diligentius sanctam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrosanctum esse nihil potest, nisi quod populus plebesve sanxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanxisset jura nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:11:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: jus utile civitati, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 904</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (legibus) illa eadem sancta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aut morte tuā sancienda sint consulum imperia, aut impunitate in perpetuum abroganda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SENTENTIAM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <trans><tr>to ratify the treaty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera sanguine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> post Red. ad Quir. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 46</bibl>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera fulmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42484.3" n="B" level="2"> Sancire lege (edicto, etc.) aliquid, de aliquā re, ut, ne, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">alia moribus confirmarunt, sanxerunt autem alia legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus id agrorum certo capite legis confirmari atque sanciri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod aedilis plebis fuisset, contra quam sanctum legibus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne res efferatur jurejurando ac fide sanciatur petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim rogationibus plebisve scitis sancta sunt ista praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coetibus ac sacrificiis conspirationem civitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem fuit (causa) nihil de hac re lege sanciendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil lege ullā in alios sanxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de jure praediorum sanctum apud nos est jure civili, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhumanissimā lege sanxerunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habeat legibus sanctum, Si quis...uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege naturae, communi jure gentium sanctum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo duodecim tabulis sanctum, ne quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Flaccus sanxit edicto, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 28, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omne tempus gravi documento sancirent, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, quominus id postea liceret, ulla lex sanxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42484.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quibus confirmandis et sanciendis legem comitiis centuriatis laturus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 8, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acta Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dubia sunt, per vos sancire vult,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3</bibl></cit> 4, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">augurem Jovis optimi maximi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de eo nihil sanxerit, quod antea commissum non erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, quod tam accurate tamque diligenter caveat et sanciat, ut heredes sui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42484.5" n="C" level="2"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus fide sanxerunt liberos Tarentinos leges suaque omnia habituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes liberos esse sanxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42484.6" n="D" level="2"> <cb n="SANC" /> Lex sancit, <hi rend="ital">decrees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordains</hi> (with <case>acc.</case> or <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">at hoc Valeria lex non dicit, Corneliae leges non sanciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consularis lex sanxit, ne qui magistratus sine provocatione crearetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res et ab naturā profectas et ab consuetudine probatas, legum metus et religio sanxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42484.7" n="E" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">relative-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid quaeque queant, per foedera naturaï, Quid porro nequeant, sancitum quandoquidem exstat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 587</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42484.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To render sacred to any one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to devote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dedicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sancire alicui carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:215" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 215</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:344" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 11, 344</bibl>: templum, Coripp. 4, 264.—</sense><sense id="n42484.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to forbid under pain of punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enact a penalty against</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">incestum pontifices supplicio sanciunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">noxiae poena par esto, ut in suo vitio quisque plectatur: vis capite, avaritia multa, honoris cupiditas ignominiā sanciatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 19, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (sc. insidiae) quamquam video neque more turpe haberi, neque aut lege sanciri aut jure civili: tamen naturae lege sanctum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erranti viam non monstrare, quod Athenis exsecrationibus publicis sanctum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Solon capite sanxit, si qui in seditione non alterius utrius partis fuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>made it a capital offence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case> of fine: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias factas quinque et viginti assibus sanxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:31" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sanc-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n42484.10" n="A" level="2"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">rendered sacred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">established as inviolable</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">sacred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inviolable</hi> (whereas sacer signifies consecrated to a deity. Thus, e. g., a temple, grove, or the like, is sacer locus; <cit><quote lang="la">but sanctus locus is any public place which it is forbidden to injure or disturb. A sacer locus is also sanctus, but the converse is not always true): proprie dicimus sancta, quae neque sacra neque profana sunt, sed sanctione quādam confirmata, ut leges sanctae sunt, quia sanctione quādam sunt subnixae. Quod enim sanctione quādam subnixum est, id sanctum est, etsi deo non sit consecratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctum est, quod ab injuriā hominum defensum atque munitum est...In municipiis quoque muros esse sanctos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctae res, veluti muri et portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni ejus (plebis) essent sanctique sunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit> (cf. sacrosanctus): <cit><quote lang="la">societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides induciarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum esse officium, nullum jus tam sanctum atque integrum, quod non ejus scelus atque perfidia violarit et imminuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 109</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae...poëtae nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:18 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8, 18 sq.</bibl></cit>—Hence, aerarium sanctius, <hi rend="ital">a special treasure of the State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which was only to be used in cases of extreme necessity</hi> (v. aerarium).—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">hospites ab injuriā prohibent sanctosque habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vestris etiam legionibus sanctus essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 30</bibl></cit>.—Because to the idea of inviolability is readily attached that of exalted worth, of sacredness, or divinity (as, on the contrary, our word sacred afterward received the meaning of inviolable, e. g. sacred rights, a sacred promise, sacred honor, etc.), sanctus denotes, </sense><sense id="n42484.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Venerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">august</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holy</hi> (very freq. and class.); of a divinity, and of things in any way belonging to one: Saturno sancte create, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 607 Vahl.): Juno Saturnia sancta dearum, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 576</bibl> (Ann. v. 65 ib.): teque pater Tiberine (veneror) tuo cum flumine sancto, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 55 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">numen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 309</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:70" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delubra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 417</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1272" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1272</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctus augustusque fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctior dies (with sollemnis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes (of a sacrifice),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 406</bibl></cit> et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">After Augustus,</quote> <trans><tr>a title given to the emperors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:127" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctius et reverentius est visum nomen Augusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:66" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra limina sanctioris aulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:6:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 6, 8</bibl></cit> (al. aevi): <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae sanctum et venerabile nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42484.12" n="2" level="3"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">morally pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.): cum esset ille vir exemplum innocentiae, cumque illo nemo neque integrior esset in civitate<cb n="SANC" />  neque sanctior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 229</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctissimi viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines frugalissimi, sanctissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sancti et religiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sunt sancti, qui religionum colentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir in publicis religionibus foederum sanctus et diligens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:19:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 19, § 49</bibl></cit>: veteres et sancti viri, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctius consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jura magistratusque legunt sanctumque senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da (mihi) justo sanctoque videri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dareus ut erat sanctus et mitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <trans><tr>pure</tr>, <tr>chaste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctissima conjux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:83" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores (with pudicitia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:298" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 298</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">me quidem id multo magis movet, quod mihi est et sanctius antiquius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod apud omnes leve et infirmum est, id apud judicem grave et sanctum esse ducatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">est et sancta et gravis oratio (Calvi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:115" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 115</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus sanctas habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctissima disciplina (Stoicorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 371</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42484.13" n="C" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42484.14" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a saint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holy man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sancti tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 6, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sancti ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:30:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 30, 24</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42484.15" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a holy place;</hi> esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctum sanctorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:26:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 26, 34</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in sancto habitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 21, 4</bibl></cit>.—Also in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sancta sanctorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 40, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.: violare sancta, id. Judith, 9, 11. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctē</orth> (acc. to B.), <hi rend="ital">solemnly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conscientiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrupulously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with holy awe</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">jurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis sancte pius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pie sancteque colimus naturam excellentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auguste sancteque consecrare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disce verecundo sanctius ore loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa sunt severius scripta quam in antiquis legibus et sanctius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se sanctissime gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:4:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te sancte precor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae (tabulae) servantur sancte,</quote> <trans><tr>scrupulously</tr>, <tr>religiously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me ea, quae tibi promitto ac recipio, sanctissime esse observaturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines tam sancte habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla conservatae sanctissime utrobique opinionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Sallustium dicta sancte et antique,</quote> <trans><tr>purely</tr>, <tr>chastely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sancte: <entryFree id="n42485" type="main" key="sancte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sancio, <sense id="n42485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sanctesco: <entryFree id="n42486" type="hapax" key="sanctesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n42486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [sanctus], <hi rend="ital">to become sacred</hi>: per nos sanctescat genus (Pelopidarum), Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 143, 23</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 163 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
sanctificatio: <entryFree id="n42487" type="main" key="sancti^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sanctifico</etym>, <sense id="n42487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sanctification</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 1, 30</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
sanctificator: <entryFree id="n42488" type="main" key="sancti^fi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭfĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sanctifier</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Tert. ap. Prax. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:34" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 37, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sanctificium: <entryFree id="n42489" type="main" key="sancti^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sanctification;</hi> meton., <hi rend="ital">a sanctuary</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 47</bibl> (from <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> ad Rom. 6, 19</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:77:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 77, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sanctifico: <entryFree id="n42490" type="main" key="sancti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sanctusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n42490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make holy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">treat as holy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sanctify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dedicate</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 3</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
sanctificus: <entryFree id="n42491" type="main" key="sancti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sanctifico</etym>, <sense id="n42491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sanctifying</hi> (eccl. Lat.): auctor Spiritus, Juvenc. praef. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sanctiloquus: <entryFree id="n42492" type="main" key="sancti^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sanctus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n42492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking holily</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Lucas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1070</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propheta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 23, 228</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sanctimonia: <entryFree id="n42493" type="main" key="sancti^mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭmōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sanctus; cf.: acrimonia, parsimonia, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n42493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sacredness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanctity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moral purity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtuousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chastity</hi>, etc. (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad deorum religionem et sanctimoniam demigrasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere domum clausam pudori et sanctimoniae, patentem cupiditati et voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa sanctimonia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priscae sanctimoniae virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina sanctimoniā insignis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 33, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine quā nemo videbit Deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 12, 14</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1626" /> <cb n="SANC" /></sense></entryFree>
sanctimonialis: <entryFree id="n42494" type="main" key="sancti^mo_ni^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭmōnĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sanctimonia</etym>, <sense id="n42494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">holy;</hi> of Christians, <hi rend="ital">pious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religious</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a monastic life</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a nun</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭmōnĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a nun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 169" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 2:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Retract. 2, 22</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭmōnĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">holily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">degere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in a cloister</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sanctio: <entryFree id="n42495" type="main" key="sancti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sancio</etym>, <sense id="n42495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an establishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordaining</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">decreeing as inviolable</hi> under penalty of a curse; <hi rend="ital">a decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctiones sacrandae sunt ...poenā, cum caput ejus qui contra fecerit consecratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 36</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legis sanctio poenaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctio legum, quae novissime certam poenam irrogat iis, qui praeceptis legis non obtemperaverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">interdum in sanctionibus adicitur, ut qui ibi aliquid commisit, capite puniatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vero leges Porciae quicquam praeter sanctionem attulerunt novi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus valet sanctio permissione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacere irritas sanctiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pragmatica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sanctitas: <entryFree id="n42496" type="main" key="sancti^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sanctus</etym>. <sense id="n42496.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Inviolability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacredness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanctity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 37, 79</bibl></cit>: regum, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl>; cf.: regii nominis, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 4, 211</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctitas templi insulaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templo sanctitatem tribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">augusti atque inviolati soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mecum deorum et hominum sanctitates omnes et religiones afuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: propter sanctitatem aliquam, Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 8</bibl>: patria sanctitas, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 4, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42496.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to sanctus, B.) <hi rend="ital">Moral purity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanctity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">virtue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">integrity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chastity</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes cives sic existimant, quasi lumen aliquod exstinctis ceteris elucere sanctitatem et prudentiam et dignitatem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum veteris sanctitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos ipsos innocentiā et sanctitate laetari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pudor, si modestia, si pudicitia, si temperantia poenae metu coercebuntur, non sanctitate suā se tuebuntur?</quote> <trans><tr>virtue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos placatos pietas efficiet et sanctitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctitas est scientia colendorum deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae potest esse pietas? quae sanctitas? quae religio?... cum quā (pietate) simulet sanctitatem et religionem tolli necesse est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:23:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 23, 90</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum cultus religionumque sanctitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 13, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2739</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">pudorem sanctitatemque feminarum abrogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dominae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docentis,</quote> <trans><tr>towards his pupils</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:40" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 40</bibl></cit>. —Of a man, <hi rend="ital">chastity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:29:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 29, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir summae sanctitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Trig. Tyr. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctitas (orationis) Calvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctitas et ut sic dicam virilitas ab his (sc. veteribus Latinis) petenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit> (v. sanctus, near the end).—As the title of a bishop, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sanctitudo: <entryFree id="n42497" type="main" key="sancti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sanctus</etym>. <sense id="n42497.0" n="I" level="1"> Mostly ante-class. for sanctitas, <hi rend="ital">sacredness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanctity</hi>: Jovis, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 173, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0146,001:ib. 174:5" default="NO"><author>Turp.</author> ib. 174, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis matronae sanctitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 174:9" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 174, 9</bibl></cit>: fani, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:19 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 19 sq.</bibl>: sepulturae, Cic. Rep. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 174, 7</bibl> (4, 8 Mos.).—In <number>plur.</number>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 174, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42497.1" n="II" level="1"> In the postclass. per., transf., <hi rend="ital">uprightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum tuam decet sanctitudo, Domine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:92:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 92, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sanctor: <entryFree id="n42498" type="hapax" key="sanctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sancio</etym>, <sense id="n42498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an establisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordainer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sanctuarium: <entryFree id="n42499" type="main" key="sanctu^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctŭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sanctus</etym> (postAug. for sacrarium). <sense id="n42499.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place for keeping sacred things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shrine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanctuary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aggen.</author> Limit. p. 61</bibl> Goes.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 8, 13</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n42499.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The private cabinet</hi> of a prince: <cit><quote lang="la">Mithridatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 77, § 149</bibl></cit>; Sicul. Fl. p. 16 Goes.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2388</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sanctus: <entryFree id="n42500" type="main" key="sanctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of sancio.</entryFree>
sancus: <entryFree id="n42501" type="main" key="Sancus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sancus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity of the Sabines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also worshipped at Rome;</hi> the same as Dius Fidius and Semo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 66</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:213 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 213 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> <cb n="SANG" /> (5), 9, 74 (Müll. sanctus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:422" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 422</bibl>; Fest. s. v. praedia, p. 238 Müll.; id. s. v. propter, p. 229 ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 15, 8</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 19; and v. Semo.</sense></entryFree>
sandala: <entryFree id="n42502" type="main" key="sanda^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandăla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very white kind of corn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 11, § 62</bibl> (v. l. scandala); also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">scandŭla</orth>, Edict. Diocl. 27; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sandaliarius: <entryFree id="n42503" type="main" key="sanda^li^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandălĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sandalium</etym>, <sense id="n42503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sandals</hi>: Apollo Sandaliarius, <hi rend="ital">who had a statue in the Sandal-street</hi> (in the fourth region of Rome), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 57</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sandălĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. vicus), <hi rend="ital">Sandal-street</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Shoemakers</hi>'<hi rend="ital">-street</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Sandaliario forte apud librarios fuimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">VICVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> p. 79, 5</bibl></cit>.—Sandaliarius signifies also <hi rend="ital">a sandal-maker</hi> in Inscr. Spon. Miscell. Ant. p. 114 (perh. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 39</bibl>, sandaliarii sutores should be read instead of sedentarii sutores).</sense></entryFree>
sandaligerulae: <entryFree id="n42504" type="hapax" key="sanda^li^ge^ru^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandălĭgĕrŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sandalium-gerulus</etym>, <sense id="n42504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">maids who carried their mistresses</hi>' <hi rend="ital">slippers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sandal-bearers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slipper-carriers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sandalios: <entryFree id="n42505" type="main" key="Sanda^li^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sandălĭos</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near Samos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 5, 37, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sandaliotis: <entryFree id="n42506" type="main" key="Sanda^li^o_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sandălĭōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sandaliw=tis,</foreign> <sense id="n42506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient name of Sardinia; acc.</hi> Sandaliotim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sandalis: <entryFree id="n42507" type="main" key="sanda^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of palm-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sandalium: <entryFree id="n42508" type="greek" key="sanda^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandălĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<number>plur.</number> scanned sandālĭa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:2:65" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 2, 65</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">sanda/lion,</foreign> <sense id="n42508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slipper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sandal</hi>, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 427, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 10, 3</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sandapila: <entryFree id="n42509" type="main" key="sanda^pi^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandăpĭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a common kind of bier</hi> for people of the lower classes (persons of rank were borne on a lectica), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:75:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 75, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:81:2" default="NO">2, 81, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:3:12" default="NO">9, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:175" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Expos. Serm. Ant. p. 558</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sandapilarius: <entryFree id="n42510" type="main" key="sanda^pi^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandăpĭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sandapila</etym>, <sense id="n42510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that carries a</hi> sandapila, <hi rend="ital">a corpse-bearer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sandapilo: <entryFree id="n42511" type="gloss" key="sanda^pi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandăpĭlo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">nekroqa/pths,</foreign> Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
sandaraca: <entryFree id="n42512" type="greek" key="sanda^ra^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandărăca</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sandĕrăca</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">san-dărăcha</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sandara/kh</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">sandara/xh</foreign>). <sense id="n42512.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sandarach</hi>, a red coloring matter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 56, § 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:39" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 6, 22, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:12:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 8, 3</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=324" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 324</bibl> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n42512.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bee-bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> cerinthus <hi rend="ital">and</hi> erithace. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 7, 7, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sandaracatus: <entryFree id="n42513" type="main" key="sanda^ra^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandărăcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sandaraca, I.</etym>, <sense id="n42513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mixed with sandarach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sandaraceus: <entryFree id="n42514" type="main" key="sanda^ra^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandărăcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of sandarach</hi>: color, Labeo ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 559, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sandaracinus: <entryFree id="n42515" type="greek" key="sanda^ra^ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandărăcīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sandĕr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sandara/kinos,</foreign> <sense id="n42515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the color of sandarach</hi>: os (merulae), Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=324" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 324</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. p. 24 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
sandaresus: <entryFree id="n42516" type="main" key="sandare_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandarēsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone found in India and Arabia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of onyx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 28, § 102</bibl> (also, sandrastos, sandaresius, sandarestos).</sense></entryFree>
sandix: <entryFree id="n42517" type="main" key="sandix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sandix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sandyx</orth>), [imacrbreve]cis (long, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25</bibl> (3, 20), 45; <sense id="n42517.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">short,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 86</bibl></cit>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/nduc</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">sa/ndic</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">vermilion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a color like vermilion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 12, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:40" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 6, 23, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:45" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 6, 26, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 45</bibl>; Prop. l. l.; Grat. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sane: <entryFree id="n42518" type="main" key="sa_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sanus <sense id="n42518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sanesco: <entryFree id="n42519" type="main" key="sa_nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sānesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n42519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [sanus], <hi rend="ital">to become sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heal</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">insanientes sub somno sanescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 214</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
sangarius: <entryFree id="n42520" type="main" key="Sanga^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sangărĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. Sagaris.</entryFree>
sangualis: <entryFree id="n42521" type="main" key="Sangua_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sanguālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Sanqualis.</entryFree>
sanguen: <entryFree id="n42522" type="main" key="sanguen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. sanguis <sense id="n42522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sanguiculus: <entryFree id="n42523" type="hapax" key="sangui^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sanguis</etym>, <sense id="n42523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blood-pudding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">black-pudding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 14, 58, § 209</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sanguilentus: <entryFree id="n42524" type="main" key="sangui^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguĭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sanguinolentus.</entryFree>
sanguinalis: <entryFree id="n42525" type="main" key="sangui^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. sanguinarius, I.</entryFree>
sanguinarius: <entryFree id="n42526" type="main" key="sangui^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (also late Lat. <orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguĭnāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 42, 5</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sanguis</etym>, <sense id="n42526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blood-</hi>, </sense><sense id="n42526.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: herba, <hi rend="ital">an herb that stanches blood</hi>, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">polu/gonon,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called sanguinaria alone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 113</bibl></cit>, and sanguinalis herba, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: latus sanguinare, <hi rend="ital">covered</hi> <cb n="SANG" /> <hi rend="ital">with blood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 42, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42526.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">blood-thirsty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanguinary</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudius (with saevus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella (with cruenta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud responsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 53, § 169</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sanguinatio: <entryFree id="n42527" type="main" key="sangui^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sanguino</etym>, <sense id="n42527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bleeding</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:6:87" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 6, 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sanguineus: <entryFree id="n42528" type="main" key="sangui^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sanguis</etym>. <sense id="n42528.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blood-</hi> (class.; a favorite word of the Aug. poets): imber, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 360</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 408</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 334</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:436" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 760" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 760</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 72, § 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:308" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 308</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:134" default="NO">6, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:173" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:588" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 588</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42528.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Blood-thirsty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hannibal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:40" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mavors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 153</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42528.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">blood-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blood-red</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">jubae (anguium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cometae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:519" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 16, 56, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 18, 30, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:9:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:242" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 242</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sanguino: <entryFree id="n42529" type="main" key="sangui^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n42529.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be bloody; to bleed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run with blood</hi> (postAug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">femina sanguinans (in menstruation),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertos sanguinantes porrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 10:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 10, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:18" default="NO">10, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42529.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be of a blood-color</hi>: unda purpureis profundis, Sol. poët. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> II. p. 384</bibl> Burm. (234 Meyer): <cit><quote lang="la">colubrum veneno noxio colla sanguinantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 160, 20</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguineae jubae anguium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 207</bibl></cit>). —* </sense><sense id="n42529.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be blood-thirsty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanguinary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinans eloquentia (sc. delatorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sanguinolentia: <entryFree id="n42530" type="main" key="sangui^no^lentia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguĭnŏlentia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sanguinolentus</etym>, <sense id="n42530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a congestion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blood-shot condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sanguinolentus: <entryFree id="n42531" type="main" key="sangui^no^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguĭnŏlentus</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">san-guĭlentus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 182" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 182</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sanguis</etym> <sense id="n42531.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full of blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloody</hi> (class., but, like sanguineus, mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic.): torques, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 18</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">soror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:844" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 844</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erinys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Curetes) inter se armis Ludunt in numerumque exsultant sanguinolenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 631</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Lachm. ad h. l.: Allia...vulneribus Latiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 414</bibl></cit>: seditiones, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 465, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42531.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bloodred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 12, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42531.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full of blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bloody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanguinary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 39, 51</bibl></cit>: centesimae, qs. <hi rend="ital">bloodsucking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:10:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>offensive</tr>, <tr>injurious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sanguinosus: <entryFree id="n42532" type="main" key="sangui^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>; <sense id="n42532.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in late medic. lang.,</quote> <trans><tr>sanguineous</tr>, <tr>plethoric</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sanguis: <entryFree id="n42533" type="main" key="sanguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sanguis</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> SANGVEM, Inscr. Fratr. Arval. tab. 41, 22; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2270</bibl> and 5054; cf. ex-sanguis, <case>acc.</case> -em.—<sense id="n42533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> collat. form sanguen, ante-class., Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 224</bibl>; id.ap.Cic.Rep. 1, 41, 64; id.ap.<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:58:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 58, 218</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 708</bibl> P.; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>; Att. and Varr. ap. Non. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 837</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:860" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 860</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 59, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 36</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; prob. root sak-, sag-, to drop, flow; cf. Angl.-Sax. sūc-an; Germ. saugen</etym>, <hi rend="ital">blood</hi> (class. only in the <number>sing.</number>; cf. cruor). </sense><sense id="n42533.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttam haut habeo sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: quod sanguen defluxerat, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine sanguine hoc fieri non posse,</quote> <trans><tr>bloodshed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguen creari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 837</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis venas et sanguen...esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:860" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 860</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quem (ventriculum cordis) sanguis a jecore per venam illam cavam influit: eoque modo ex his partibus sanguis per venas in omne corpus diffunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius Atratus sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 43, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumine sanguinis meum reditum interclu, dendum putaverunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Red. ad Quir. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiatum est, in foro Subertano sanguinis rivos per totum diem fluxisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rivi sanguis flammam orientem restinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: pugnatum ingenti caede utrimque,<pb n="1627" /> <cb n="SANG" />  plurimo sanguine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 64</bibl>: haurire sanguinem, <hi rend="ital">to shed</hi> (another's) <hi rend="ital">blood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad meum sanguinem hauriendum advolaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 24, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti sanguinis nostri hauriendi est sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi hauriendum sanguinem laniendaque viscera nostra praebuerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relicum sanguinem jubentes haurire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 51, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum sanguinem invicem hausimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum sanguinem hauserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:30:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 30, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 1, 8</bibl>: sanguinem dare, <hi rend="ital">to shed</hi> (one's own) <hi rend="ital">blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi> (one's) <hi rend="ital">life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in beluas strinximus ferrum, hauriendus aut dandus est sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dandus invidiae est sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 54, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid super sanguinis, qui dari pro re publicā posset, rogitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 58, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:18:2" default="NO">3, 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem mittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to bleed</tr>, <tr>let blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: emittere sanguinem de aure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub caudā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:6:4" default="NO">6, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:9:1" default="NO">6, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">demere (e capite),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrahere (ex auriculā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex adversā parte de auriculā sanguinem mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supprimere sanguinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to stanch</tr>, <tr>stop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: cohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 71, § 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 7, 25, § 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:239" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 18, 73, § 239</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42533.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir sanguinum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bloody</tr>, <tr>violent</tr>, <tr>cruel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 16, 7</bibl></cit>, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">54, 23</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libera me de sanguinibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the guilt of shedding blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vae civitati sanguinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 24, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42533.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (class.; esp. freq. in the poets). </sense><sense id="n42533.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Blood</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">consanguinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">descent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">family.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42533.5" n="a" level="4"> Abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine conjuncti,</quote> <trans><tr>blood-relations</tr>, <tr>relatives by blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 161</bibl></cit>;
